Center"
"Kyle Kuzma
                 
                 
                      - F -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kyle Kuzma grabbed a career-high 15 boards with 12 points, three assists, two steals and two 3-pointers in 32 minutes against the Mavs on Saturday.
        
        
             His playing time was a little inconsistent to end January, but that probably won't be the case anymore. Coach Luke Walton went away from Kuzma at times because of his defense, but that was because he had Larry Nance. Expect Kuzma to look more like the Kuzmania version we saw to finish 2017.

"Nick Young
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nick Young scored nine points in just four minutes off the bench in Saturday's 122-105 in against San Antonio.
        
        
             Swaggy P made the most of his few minutes off the bench, hitting 3-of-5 from the field, including 3-of-4 from behind the 3-point line. Despite the sharp shooting, he played just four minutes. That's not good for anyone's fantasy value. He is still only worth fantasy consideration in the deepest of leagues until further notice.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"David West
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            David West ended up Saturday's 122-105 win against the Spurs with 14 points, four rebounds, an assist and a blocked shot over 17 minutes off the bench.
        
        
             West was a very efficient 6-of-6 from the field, as he picked up the slack with Kevin Durant struggling a bit with his shot. Head coach Steve Kerr might have leaned upon West even more if he weren't in foul trouble for most of the evening. Despite the fact that he saved Golden State's bacon for the second time this week, his fantasy appeal remains rather minimal.

"Brook Lopez
                 
                 
                      - C -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Brook Lopez scored 16 points with two rebounds, five assists and one 3-pointer in 26 minutes against the Mavs on Saturday.
        
        
             He was one of the biggest fantasy winners at the trade deadline because Larry Nance was taking a lot of his minutes. Lopez can be a top-50 player with minutes in the mid 20s, so his fantasy owners should consider him a must-start player again.

"Kevin Durant
                 
                 
                      - F -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kevin Durant ended up with just 10 points, six rebounds and six assists over 29 minutes in Saturday's 122-105 win against the Spurs.
        
        
             The overall line wasn't terrible, but he was just 3-of-9 from the field, including 0-of-1 from behind the 3-point arc. KD was able to help out with two blocked shots, too, so it wasn't a total loss. However, he'll look to get back on track Monday against Phoenix, the worst defensive team in the NBA. Perhaps Durant's hand was still bothering him a bit, causing him to miss shots he'd normally make.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 10 - 11:52 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Draymond Green
                 
                 
                      - F -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Draymond Green finished with 17 points, 11 assists and eight rebounds over 35 minutes in Saturday's 122-105 win against San Antonio.
        
        
             Green also chipped in with a steal and a blocked shot while turning in a solid plus-14 rating. He hit 8-of-16 from the field, and was 1-of-5 from behind the 3-point line. Surprisingly, he didn't make any trips to the free-throw line. Green has a pair of double-doubles over his past two outings, but he did it with points and rebounds in his last contest. Green is also working on a 12-game streak with at least one blocked shot.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 10 - 11:49 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Josh Hart
                 
                 
                      - G -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Josh Hart scored nine points with two rebounds, one assist and three 3-pointers in 29 minutes against the Mavs on Saturday.
        
        
             The usage was down a tad, but Hart isn't really a scorer anyway. The big difference is that he only had two boards after he averaged 11.0 per game over his previous four, adding averages of 13.5 points, 3.0 dimes, 1.3 steals and 2.5 treys. He'll be getting his minutes the rest of the way and it's possible he still starts even when Lonzo Ball returns. He should be owned in standard leagues.

"Julius Randle
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Julius Randle scored 26 points with eight rebounds, seven assists and five turnovers in 37 minutes against the Mavs on Saturday.
        
        
             He's really picked it up and he came through in the hometown game. Randle is a huge fantasy winner from the Larry Nance Jr. deal and he's already really picked it up even before the deadline. He should be looking at a strong finish to redeem his bad start this season.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Klay Thompson
                 
                 
                      - G -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Klay Thompson finished with 25 points in Saturday's 122-105 victory against the visiting Spurs.
        
        
             Thompson hit 10-of-14 from the field, including 5-of-6 from behind the 3-point line, while adding three rebounds. Whatever was bugging him at the end of January, when he was off with his shot, is apparently in the rear-view mirror. He has hit two or more 3-points in each of his past six outings while averaging 19.7 PPG, 4.2 RPG and 2.8 APG.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 10 - 11:43 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Stephen Curry
                 
                 
                      - G -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stephen Curry (ankle) finished with 17 points, eight assists, four rebounds and two steals over 29 minutes in Saturday's 122-105 win against the visiting Spurs.
        
        
             Curry hit 7-of-13 from the field, and 3-of-7 from behind the 3-point line. He was limping heading into a timeout late in the first quarter, but he said after the game that his right ankle was ""fine."" It's possible, even if his ankle if fine, that he could be rested on Monday against the defensively-challenged Phoenix Suns, as Curry has a busy schedule heading into the All-Star weekend. But so far it appears he can and wants to play through the injury.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Anthony Slater on Twitter                         Feb 10 - 11:39 PM

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Lauri Markkanen
                 
                 
                      - F -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Lauri Markkanen scored 12 points with 10 rebounds, two steals and one 3-pointer in 33 minutes against the Wizards during a 101-90 loss to the Wizards on Saturday.
        
        
             Maybe he's a little rusty after missing a week, but Markkanen has struggled on back-to-back sets. Compared to days with rest, Markkanen's scoring and rebounding are noticeably worse when he's on a back-to-back. He'll be outstanding the rest of the way, but DFS players may want to file this note away for the next B2B.

"Denzel Valentine
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Denzel Valentine made a spot start against the Wizards on Saturday with 10 points, 10 rebounds, five assists, one steal and two 3-pointers in 34 minutes.
        
        
             Zach LaVine resting today moved Valentine into the first unit for this loss. Valentine has also slightly benefitted from Kris Dunn (concussion) missing time, but Dunn is finally starting to get close to a return. Valentine is only worth owning in deeper leagues.

"Kelly Oubre
                 
                 
                      - F -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kelly Oubre made 3-of-14 from the field for 11 points with eight rebounds, three assists, one block and three 3-pointers in 39 minutes in the starting lineup for Markieff Morris (illness) on Saturday.
        
        
             He really can't make shots right now. In his last 10 games, his 32.0 field goal percentage is almost lower than his 29.2 minutes per game. Oubre has a big opportunity right now, but he really needs to start hitting shots to put up value. He's still a hold in most situations.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Bryn Forbes
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Bryn Forbes finished scoreless in 20 minutes off the bench in Saturday's 122-105 loss at Golden State.
        
        
             Forbes was a dismal 0-of-7 from the field, including 0-of-3 from behind the 3-point line, and he didn't have any other statistics beside his one turnover and minus-19 rating. Not good. He and Danny Green struggled, so thankfully veteran Manu Ginobili was able to step up and give the Spurs something off of the bench. Forbes will look to bounce back Monday at Utah.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Manu Ginobili
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Manu Ginobili ended up with 13 points over 19 minutes off the bench in Saturday's 122-105 loss at Golden State.
        
        
             Ginobili hit 5-of-13 from the field, including 3-of-8 from behind the 3-point line, while adding six assists and one rebound with just one turnover. The ageless wonder saw a little extra playing time with Danny Green and Bryn Forbes struggling and Dejounte Murray and Tony Parker out due to injury. Ginobili took advantage, but he still remains nothing more than a low-end fantasy option in deeper leagues at this point of his career.

             He really stepped up with Ian Mahinmi and Markieff Morris dealing with illnesses. Those two likely won't be out long, so Scott isn't much of a pickup in most leagues.

"Joel Embiid
                 
                 
                      - C -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Joel Embiid scored 29 points with 16 rebounds, two assists, one steal, three blocks and and one 3-pointer in 34 minutes against the Clippers during a 112-98 win on Saturday.
        
        
             It was a scary game for Embiid with several bumps and bruises. Embiid had to go to the locker room, but he was able to return. He was also asked about it after the game and didn't sound too concerned. He said his knee took contact from the floor and it didn't twist, and he said he knew he was going to check back in after the quick trip. Embiid also said he didn't get treatment and that he wasn't nervous about coming back. He should be ready to roll, but don't be surprised to see him on the injury report as a precaution. Trust The Process.

"Derrick White
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Derrick White scored 11 points across 28 minutes off the bench in Saturday's loss at Golden State.
        
        
             White hit 3-of-8 from the field, including 0-of-2 from behind the 3-point line, while going 5-of-6 from the free-throw stripe. He also added seven rebounds, two assists and a steal, outplaying Patty Mills. It appears White will see a good chunk of playing time while Dejounte Murray and Tony Parker are on the shelf. White could even potentially draw a start Monday in Utah with as bad as Mills looked in a starting role on Saturday.

"Patty Mills
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Patty Mills made the start Saturday at Golden State, but he ended up with just seven points across 18 minutes.
        
        
             Mills hit just 3-of-10 from the field, including 1-of-5 from behind the 3-point line, and he seems to look a lot more comfortable coming off of the bench. The good news is he did not turn the ball over, but he also didn't contribute much in the way of the other offensive categories, either. Even with Dejounte Murray and Tony Parker out, Mills posted a rather underwhelming line.

He'll look to keep up the good work on Monday at Utah.

"Davis Bertans
                 
                 
                      - F -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Davis Bertans finished with 10 points, five rebounds, four assist and a steal with no turnovers across 31 minutes in Saturday's 122-105 loss at Golden State.
        
        
             Bertans continues to start with Pau Gasol coming off the bench, and he is doing a decent enough job. He was an efficient 4-of-7 from the field, while going 1-of-4 from behind the 3-point line. The good news is that he is taking good care of the basketball, but coach Gregg Popovich wouldn't commit to Bertans as the long-term starter. He remains useful only in the deepest of fantasy leagues even if he is a part of the starting five.

                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"LaMarcus Aldridge
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            LaMarcus Aldridge tied for the team high with 20 points in Saturday's 122-105 loss at Golden State.
        
        
             Aldridge was a very efficient 9-of-14 from the field, and a perfect 2-of-2 from the free-throw line. He also added five rebounds, four assists and two blocked shots over his 29 minutes, but things go away from San Antonio in the second half after they built a 10-point lead after one quarter. Aldridge continues to be the most steady fantasy option in San Antonio, turning in top-50 value for a team which has had to scramble for most of the season to replace star Kawhi Leonard. If not for Aldridge the Spurs would really be in a world of hurt.

Jordan had a very strong defensive game against Joel Embiid and he'll continue to be among the leaders on the glass.                 Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Anthony Davis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Anthony Davis went bonkers during a 138-128 double-overtime win over the Nets on Saturday, scoring 44 points with 17 rebounds, two assists, six steals, three blocks and three 3-pointers in 50 minutes.
        
        
             Well, this line probably swung some fantasy matchups. Since steals became official in 1973-74, Anthony Davis joins Bob McAdoo as the only players with multiple career games with at least 40 points, 15 rebounds and 5 steals. The Pelicans needed this win badly and they did blow a 28-point lead, so coming away with the win is big time. Davis is going to be incredible without Boogie Cousins.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Elias Sports                                      Feb 10 - 10:33 PM

"Nikola Mirotic
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nikola Mirotic scored 21 points with 16 rebounds, one assist, two steals, two 3-pointers and a career-high five blocks against the Nets on Saturday.
        
        
             He was protecting the rim a bunch with three blocks on Spencer Dinwiddie, one on Quincy Acy and one on DeMarre Carroll. We have seen too many bad games from Mirotic to count including Friday night, but he has a knack for some stat-stuffing lines like this one. He should be owned in all leagues.

"Bobby Portis
                 
                 
                      - F -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Bobby Portis was ejected for a flagrant foul on Tomas Satoransky on Saturday.
        
        
             It was a really bad foul and an easy flagrant two. There's a chance Portis can get a suspension for this foul, so his owners will want to make sure he's a go for the next one. He had a decent game on Saturday with 13 points, four rebounds, one assist, one steal and one 3-pointer in 23 minutes.

                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Tomas Satoransky
                 
                 
                      - G -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tomas Satoransky went to the locker room after a fall in the fourth quarter on Saturday against the Bulls.
        
        
             It was scary on a bad flagrant two from Bobby Portis. Satoransky looked to be bleeding from his head and he's getting checked for a concussion right now. Hopefully he's OK because Tim Frazier also went down with a nasal fracture. Before the injury, Satoransky exploded for a career-high 25 points with three rebounds, six assists, two steals and five 3-pointers in 37 minutes. The Wizards will probably be signing Derrick Rose.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"D.J. Augustin
                 
                 
                      - G -  Magic
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            D.J. Augustin made the start Saturday against the Bucks, finishing with 11 points.
        
        
             It wasn't a great shooting night, as was 2-of-7 from the field, including 0-of-4 from behind the 3-point line. He did all of his damage at the free-throw line, finishing a perfect 7-of-7. It was his 22nd time scoring in double digits this season. He'll continue to have a little more playing time with Aaron Gordon (hip) on the mend, but he'll need to shoot better if he wants to keep Shelvin Mack from carving into his playing time.

"Marco Belinelli
                 
                 
                      - G -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marco Belinelli plans to sign with the 76ers once he clears waivers, according to Shams Charania of Yahoo! Sports.
        
        
             More people are trusting the process these days and they'll add another great shooter in Belinelli. He will be coming off the bench and should find himself getting minutes close to 20. It'll be interesting to see if he takes minutes from guys like T.J. McConnell or maybe a struggling Robert Covington. Belinelli isn't worth adding in most leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Shams Charania on Twitter                         Feb 10 - 10:10 PM

"Shelvin Mack
                 
                 
                      - G -  Magic
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Shelvin Mack ended up with 19 points over 28 minutes in Saturday's 111-104 loss against Milwaukee.
        
        
             Mack posted a season-high in assists and his first double-double of the season. It was also the sixth double-double of his NBA career. D.J. Augustin didn't do much in a starting role, so Mack had the hot hand and was given a few more minutes. He has some short-term fantasy appeal in deeper leagues while Aaron Gordon (hip) is on the mend.

"Mario Hezonja
                 
                 
                      - F -  Magic
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Mario Hezonja posted a team-high 23 points in Saturday's 111-104 loss against the visiting Bucks over 35 minutes.
        
        
             Hezonja has now posted 20 or more points for just the third time this season, with two of those performances coming over the past five days. He also chipped in with three rebounds and three steals, ending up 8-of-16 from the field with 1-of-5 from behind the 3-point line. Hezonja stayed put at the NBA trade deadline and that appears to be a big relief to him. He has some nice short-term fantasy value while Aaron Gordon (hip) is sidelined, too.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 10 - 10:08 PM

"Rajon Rondo
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Rajon Rondo scored 25 points with 10 rebounds, 12 assists and one block in 42 minutes for his second triple-double this season against the Nets on Saturday.
        
        
             He had a left shoulder injury down the stretch in the fourth quarter, but he was able to return. Rondo looked fine upon his return and helped his team get this win. He's also been going to the line more with a 3-of-6 today and four attempts on Friday, which puts him one shy of his 6-of-11 in his previous 951 minutes this season. He's been solid for his fantasy owners.

"Spencer Dinwiddie
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Spencer Dinwiddie was busy in his 43 minutes during a 138-128 double-overtime loss to the Pelicans on Saturday, making 5-of-22 from the field for 24 points with four rebounds, 10 assists, three steals and two 3-pointers.
        
        
             While he did struggle to make shots, he is completely locked in as the offense runs through him on the vast majority of possessions when he's out there. Dinwiddie actually had 25 potential assists on Wednesday, but his teammates couldn't make shots to get him to 11 dimes against the Pistons. Dinwiddie has to be a candidate for Most Improved Player right now and the Nets reportedly turned down a first-round pick to keep him. He's a starting NBA point guard and he's thriving in a PG-friendly system.

If he's out, we'll see more Raul Neto while Royce O'Neale and Alec Burks could play more, too.

He'll have 48 hours to recover before Sunday's favorable matchup vs. the Knicks.

             He'll be out of the rotation with Jordan Clarkson and George Hill around. Calderon is still a fantasy legend.

"Cedi Osman
                 
                 
                      - F -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Cedi Osman was phenomenal in his first NBA start against the Hawks on Friday, scoring 16 points with six rebounds, five assists, three steals, two  3-pointers and two turnovers in 39 minutes.
        
        
             No trip to the Dagobah System needed for this Cedi. Osman's play on Wednesday was reportedly part of the reason why Dwyane Wade, was sent to Miami, and it paid immediate dividends. As great as he's been, he'll have some serious competition coming in the form of Rodney Hood, Jordan, Clarkson, Larry Nance and George Hill. He'll probably be sticking in the rotation, but he's only a deep-league flier until we see him do it with a full roster.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Lou Williams
                 
                 
                      - G -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Fresh off a new contract extension, Lou Williams dropped 26 points on 7-of-12 shots in Friday's 108-95 win over the Pistons.
        
        
             Williams also hit 8-of-9 free throws, adding six assists, four rebounds, two steals, four triples and four turnovers in 31 minutes. Williams just recently signed a three-year extension worth $24 million that includes a team option for a third season, an absolute bargain for a player that could've easily been selected to the All-Star game. ""It was nice for the organization to commit to me the same way I've committed to these guys this year,"" Williams said. He has top-20 value in 9-category leagues for the past month and could hold early-round value the rest of the way unless the Clippers start to slide in the standings. His fantasy owners should be thrilled he wasn't traded.

"Marco Belinelli
                 
                 
                      - G -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marco Belinelli has been officially waived by the Hawks.
        
        
             Assuming he clears waivers, Belinelli will be a free agent and can sign with any team he wants. ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski said the Thunder, Spurs and 76ers tried to obtain him at the deadline and they do have a roster spot, so they are the likely landing spots for the sharpshooter. He wouldn't have much value on those teams, though. Tyler Dorsey gets a bump with this news.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Hawks on Twitter                                  Feb 9 - 5:56 PM

"Tony Allen
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Bulls have officially waived G/F Tony Allen.
        
        
             Allen was acquired on February 1 in a trade with the New Orleans Pelicans, but was never part of the Bulls plans going forward. Allen will look to join a contender that gives him a chance to compete for a title. Even at 36 years of age, he can still bring perimeter defense to the table. However, his fantasy value is nonexistent and he should be left on waivers in all formats.

                Player Outlook

                  In-season Projections"
"Joel Embiid
                 
                 
                      - C -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Joel Embiid (right ankle) is questionable for Friday's game vs. New Orleans.
        
        
             Embiid is dealing with a right ankle issue, and it's also noteworthy that Friday night is the front end of a back-to-back for the Sixers. Embiid was cleared last week to play in the first back-to-back of his career, but it's unknown if Philadelphia will continue to play him on consecutive nights for the rest of the season. If Embiid is fighting through a nagging ankle injury, they may choose to err on the side of caution. If Embiid is ruled out, Amir Johnson and Richaun Holmes will divvy up minutes at center.
        
        
             Related: Amir Johnson, Richaun Holmes
              
             Source: Rich Hoffman on Twitter                           Feb 9 - 10:28 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Markelle Fultz
                 
                 
                      - G -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Sixers GM Bryan Colangelo said on Friday that there is possibly that Markelle Fultz (shoulder) returns soon, but that ""there is a chance"" that Fultz will not play again this season.
        
        
             Here is the full quote from Colangelo when asked about Fultz' availability: ""There's always a chance that he's going to be out there soon, and there's a chance that he's not gonna play this year. I can't answer that question because we don't know the answer to that."" Fultz's injury and rehab have been a mess since day one, and it doesn't appear there has been a substantial improvement over the last couple of weeks. Stay tuned for a further update. It seems safe to leave him on waivers in standard-sized re-draft leagues.

"Kemba Walker
                 
                 
                      - G -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kemba Walker netted 40 points on 13-of-26 shooting Thursday, to go with six 3-pointers, one rebound, three assists and four steals, but the end result was a 109-103 overtime loss to Portland.
        
        
             Walker took over down the stretch, rocking an insane 65.8 usage rate through the fourth quarter of action as he scored 15 straight points to force overtime. He was also a perfect 8-of-8 from the charity stripe to give him a sterling 67.8 true shooting percentage, and he was phenomenal on the defensive end of the floor, holding Damian Lillard to just 6-of-22 shooting. He was named Kristaps Porzingis (knee) replacement in the All-Star game today, and it's obvious why.

"Luke Kornet
                 
                 
                      - C -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Luke Kornet had a terrific NBA debut on the stat sheet against the Raptors on Thursday, scoring 11 points with 10 rebounds, four blocks and three 3-pointers in 22 minutes.
        
        
             This was not a garbage time special with Kornet getting minutes in the first quarter as Kyle O'Quinn's backup. He's one of the best-shooting seven-footers in the G League and the Knicks gave him a green light with seven attempts from deep -- his jumper is silky smooth. Enes Kanter (mouth) probably won't be out for too long, but Kornet does offer some upside for points, boards, blocks and treys. If you are in a deep league and you hate the guy at the end of your bench, maybe it's time to give The UniKornet a look to see what happens. By the way, shoutout to the Knicks new beat writer Mike Vorkunov for the UniKornet nickname.

             There was some talk about Schroder possibly getting traded to Phoenix, but the Hawks and Suns couldn't come to terms. The Hawks are sitting in the No. 1 lottery spot with a lot of bad teams right on their tail, so hopefully this won't affect Schroder's playing time too much. He's obviously still a hold in all leagues and should post mid-round value.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 8 - 9:41 PM

"Elfrid Payton
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Orlando has traded Elfrid Payton to Phoenix for a second-round pick, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.com.
        
        
             The Magic have been looking to dump Payton off their roster, and now the Suns will get his rights. The pick is from the Troy Daniels deal in the 2017 offseason, so the Suns aren't giving up much to take a look at Payton. This is a good landing spot for Payton's fantasy value and he'll probably be starting next to Devin Booker. Plus, he'll be even busier while Booker recovers from his torso injuries. The Suns have lost their faith in Tyler Ulis, and Josh Gray shouldn't see a boatload of minutes. On the Magic side, both Shelvin Mack and D.J. Augustin could be getting more minutes at the point with DJA having a higher floor and being worth a look in standard leagues. As of now, it is unknown if Payton will make his Suns debut on Saturday vs. the Nuggets.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Adrian Wojnarowski on Twitter                     Feb 8 - 2:56 PM

"Emmanuel Mudiay
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Point guard Emmanuel Mudiay will be traded to the Knicks in a three-team trade involving Dallas and Denver.
        
        
             Mudiay goes to the Knicks, where he could eventually start at point guard over Jarrett Jack and Frank Ntilikina, Doug McDermott will go from the Knicks to the Mavericks, and veteran Devin Harris will end up in Denver. Mudiay is the youngest and, arguably, best player in this deal, but whether he starts for a team going nowhere remains to be seen. But any way you slice it, Frank Ntilikina took a big hit today and can be dropped in re-draft leagues, while Mudiay is nothing more than a speculative add at this point.
        
        
             Related: Jarrett Jack, Frank Ntilikina, Trey Burke

"Dwyane Wade

            Luke Babbitt will be traded to the Heat for forward Omari White.
        
        
             It's a minor deadline-day trade that gives Miami some welcome perimeter shooting, but doesn't move the needle for fantasy purposes. There's no reason to touch Babbitt in any fantasy leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Marc Spears on Twitter                            Feb 8 - 12:11 PM

"Larry Nance
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Larry Nance has been traded to the Cavaliers.
        
        
             Nance and Clarkson will head to Cleveland in exchange for Isaiah Thomas, Channing Frye and Cleveland's first-round pick. The Cavaliers rank 13th in the NBA in pace, but you'd think that will go up with Nance and JC running the floor. Barring another move (Cleveland is linked to DeAndre Jordan), Nance will compete for minutes with Tristan Thompson and Jae Crowder, but only needs minutes in the 20s to help fantasy owners. He's a solid add, but the deadline could create better pickups.
        
        
             Related: Channing Frye, Isaiah Thomas, Jordan Clarkson

             And we're off. The Cavs get themselves some much needed help to their backcourt, and chances are they are not done here. Clarkson isn't the best shooter, so he will likely be coming off the bench. Fantasy wise, this is not the best spot for Clarkson because he'll be losing shots to LeBron James and presumably other players, but maybe he can hold value with Isaiah Thomas off the roster.

Green would lose value in this scenario since Lou Williams is in Los Angeles, while Bradley may get a small bump playing for the best coach in the NBA.

            Kyle Anderson didn't score in 19 minutes on Wednesday, going 0-of-2 from the field with five boards and four assists.
        
        
             Anderson's fantasy owners shouldn't read into tonight's quiet line. The Spurs won by 48 points, three shy of the franchise record for the largest margin of victory, and Gregg Popovich wound up playing 13 different players at least 11 minutes. Rudy Gay (heel) is expected back after the All-Star break, but Anderson projects as a mid-round roto option with Kawhi Leonard (quad) out indefinitely.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Tom Orsborn on Twitter                            Feb 8 - 1:37 AM

"LaMarcus Aldridge
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            LaMarcus Aldridge destroyed the Suns on Wednesday with 23 points on 10-of-14 shooting, 13 rebounds (six offensive), four assists and two blocks in 28 minutes.
        
        
             Aldridge has led the Spurs in scoring 41 times this season, which is the highest number for any player in the league -- Giannis Antetokounmpo is second at 38 games. He's been an unheralded savior for San Antonio in the absence of Kawhi Leonard (quad), helping them attain the No. 3 seed in the West with a 35-21 record. He's sitting on top-50 value in most fantasy formats, and rises even higher if you value his 49.6% FGs, 83.8% FTs and meager 1.6 turnovers.

"Julius Randle
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Lakers have turned down several teams offering second-round picks for Julius Randle, but no one will offer a first-round pick with him headed into restricted free agency, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.com.
        
        
             This really isn't a big surprise because it's not like Randle will be fetching a ton of offers this summer. The Lakers are also expected to push back their big free agent push until 2019, so that also makes it less likely he's dealt. For now, expect him to stay put and hold decent fantasy value. We'll see if Brook Lopez gets dealt today.

"Karl-Anthony Towns
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Karl-Anthony Towns sank a career-high six 3-pointers on Wednesday, making 10-of-12 shots overall for 30 points, 10 rebounds, two blocks, one steal and one assist.
        
        
             KAT still hasn't missed a game in his NBA career, and he's compensated for decreased scoring this season with fewer turnovers and more steals, blocks and triples. This also extends KAT's league lead to 47 double-doubles, pulling away from guys like Russell Westbrook (38), Andre Drummond (37) and Dwight Howard (34). He benefited from the Cavs' non-existent perimeter defense tonight, but this isn't an aberration -- he's hitting a career-high 1.5 triples on 42.9% shooting from deep.

"James Harden
                 
                 
                      - G -  Rockets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            James Harden took over against the Heat during a 109-101 win on Wednesday, scoring 41 points with four rebounds, six assists, three steals, one block and five 3-pointers in 36 minutes.
        
        
             He had eight points in the last four minutes, including a back-breaking 29-foot jumper with 2:03 left. Coach Erik Spoelstra gave him in his props after the game because of how The Beard closed. ""He's a three-way player. Add the ability to draw fouls and you've got a four-dimensional player,"" Spoelstra said. ""He can get you to the rim. He can get you in mid-range. He can get you from the 3. He can facilitate. Then when the game's on the line, he was his best."" He has to be the MVP favorite right now. If you don't think so, you may want to listen to the words of Doc Brown from Back to the Future because you're not thinking fourth dimensionally.

"LeBron James
                 
                 
                      - F -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            LeBron James recorded his ninth triple-double of the season on Wednesday with 37 points, 15 assists, 10 rebounds, five 3-pointers, and one miraculous game-winner with 1.0 seconds left in overtime.
        
        
             LBJ helped force overtime by sinking a difficult 3-pointer with 45.0 seconds remaining, he later blocked Jimmy Butler at the rim with 1.0 second left in OT, and on the ensuing inbounds play he caught the ball at the free-throw line, turned and fired a perfect fadeaway over Butler's outstretched arm. He finished 16-of-22 from the field with one steal and one block in 48 minutes. It was a rousing home win on national TV, and the Cavs really needed it given their recent dysfunction. It's the latest reminder that LeBron is still King James.

"Stanley Johnson

             Johnson's playing time is soaring right now at 35.2 minutes over the past six games. He's leaned on primarily for defense but has contributed a solid 15.7 points (44.6% FGs, 73.7% FTs), 1.0 triples, 5.0 boards, 2.8 assists, 1.5 steals and 0.5 blocks in that span. Detroit reportedly ""ramped up their efforts"" to trade Johnson in late January, but we haven't heard him mentioned in trade rumors recently.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 7 - 10:25 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Andre Drummond
                 
                 
                      - C -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Andre Drummond (ankle) hauled in a season-high 27 rebounds during Wednesday's home win, adding 17 points, three steals, three blocks and two assists in 36 minutes.
        
        
             Drummond was dealing with a minor injury but his status was never truly in doubt, and coach Stan Van Gundy said before tip-off that Drummond was ""fine."" The reigning Eastern Conference player of the week will also be playing in his second All-Star game this month, and he's been a nice surprise for owners who gambled on draft day. The only smirch on his line tonight was percentages -- he went 5-of-17 from the field and 7-of-10 from the line.

"Blake Griffin

             Stan Van Gundy has been staggering Blake and Andre Drummond to ensure he has one of them on the floor at all times, and it's working. The Pistons have won five consecutive games, including four straight with Blake, whose chemistry with Andre Drummond has been incredible to watch. The Pistons play one fewer game than the Clippers down the stretch, but fantasy owners won't complain while Griffin is playing at this level.

"Jarrett Allen
                 
                 
                      - C -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jarrett Allen had multiple career-highs on Wednesday with 14 rebounds and six assists, adding 13 points, two blocks and one steal in a loss to the Pistons.
        
        
             Allen actually doubled his previous high for assists, and the Nets as a team had 32 dimes on 39 made baskets. The impressive rookie has also done a good job avoiding silly fouls, with just four fouls in his past 82 minutes of action, which should help him earn more run -- Timofey Mozgov and Jahlil Okafor combined to play just 16 minutes tonight. He's the first Nets rookie center since 1983-84 with 10+ points, 10+ rebounds and 5+ assists in a game, and his fantasy owners are laughing all the way to the bank.

             This is a very interesting move with coach Alvin Gentry talking a lot about developing a rhythm. Liggins is only going to be out there for defense and he'll only be taking open shots. He's not much of a fantasy add.

"Rajon Rondo
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Rajon Rondo will come off the bench on Wednesday against the Pacers, with DeAndre Liggins drawing the start at point guard.
        
        
             Alvin Gentry said he wants Rondo with the second unit to ""provide a spark,"" which isn't traditionally the type of verbiage we hear when discussing No. 9. Rondo has played well in two of the past three games, so it'll be interesting to see how he responds to the bench role. While Liggins is starting, he still might be confined to minutes in the teens, so he's not a great target in most leagues.

""Im actually surprised at how good it feels considering its only been a week. Ive been with (director of sport medicine) Steve Short, and hes been great. "Taurean Prince
                 
                 
                      - F -  Hawks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Hawks have reportedly made everyone available ahead of the trade deadline.
        
        
             Taurean Prince, Marco Belinelli and Ersan Ilyasova have garnered the most interest on the trade market, and while Dennis Schroder could be had for the right price, maturity issues and a large contract have made him less desirable on the open market. Belinelli and Ilyasova will almost assuredly be jettisoned ahead of the deadline, but it would likely take a fairly large offer to snag Prince. A trade away from Atlanta would not be ideal for Prince's rest-of-season outlook.

"Kris Dunn
                 
                 
                      - G -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Bulls' head coach Fred Hoiberg said that Kris Dunn (concussion) is ""still a ways away"" from getting back to the court.
        
        
             Dunn was able to participate in a G-League practice on Tuesday, but he didn't go through any contact work and he remains without an official timetable under the concussion protocol system. He is making small steps in the right direction, but it sounds like he might not be back until after the All-Star break.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Darnell Mayberry on Twitter                       Feb 7 - 1:23 PM

With Sweet Lou locked up in Los Angeles, he should easily finish the season as a top-30 guy.

             Now that Greg Monroe is gone, it's going to be interesting to see if Chandler is rested on the second night of a back-to-back set vs. the Spurs Wednesday. Alex Len doesn't look healthy right now, so maybe Chandler plays. He's still a shut-down candidate after the All-Star break, assuming he's not moved at the deadline. Fantasy owners can do better.

"Marquese Chriss
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marquese Chriss returned from a one-game suspension on Tuesday and was productive in 19 minutes off the bench, scoring 10 points with six rebounds, three assists, two blocks and two triples.
        
        
             He's inconsistent, immature and prone to foul trouble, but he can put up some nice fantasy lines when he's in the mood. Coach Jay Triano called it a matchup-based decision to bring Chriss off the bench tonight, but he was more productive than Dragan Bender was in 38 minutes. If you want to gamble on his upside after the All-Star break and like scary rollercoaster rides, Chriss could be your guy, but he's more of a stash until he strings a few good games together.

"T.J. Warren

            T.J. Warren scored 24 points in Tuesday's 112-93 loss to the Lakers, hitting 9-of-22 shots and 6-of-10 free throws with six rebounds, three assists and four steals in 36 minutes.

Concussion symptoms can appear later on, so it's not a complete lock that he's out of the woods. He gets a 3.3 usage rate bump with Devin Booker (hip, ribs) off the floor and will be a strong play once again on Wednesday vs. the Spurs, but double check to make sure he's not on the injury report.

He leads the league in technicals with 13, has been ejected three times, and is now just three more techs away from a one-game suspension.

"Joel Embiid
                 
                 
                      - C -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Joel Embiid hit 10-of-20 shots, three 3-pointers and 4-of-5 free throws for 27 points, 12 rebounds, three assists and three blocks in 32 minutes of Tuesday's 115-102 win over the Wizards.
        
        
             In a season where so much is going wrong on the injury front, Embiid has been one of the true feel-good stories, playing in a back-to-back set over the weekend and racking up six straight double-doubles. Almost every Sixers starter went off tonight, as Dario Saric had 20 points and seven boards, Ben Simmons had a 15-6-8-3-1 line and J.J. Redick scored 18 with six assists and four 3-pointers. Robert Covington was the odd man out, but still had 12 points, five boards, a steal and two 3-pointers in the win. Now excuse us as we go knock on wood.

"LeBron James
                 
                 
                      - F -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            After Tuesday's embarrassing 116-98 loss to the Magic, LeBron James said he'll ""never waive"" his no-trade clause.

""I'm here for the long haul,"" he said. ""I'm here for this season right now, try to figure out ways we can still compete. I couldn't give up on my teammates like that. I couldn't do that."" The Cavs led by as many as 21 points tonight, but they were outscored 65-31 in the second half and were held to nine points in the fourth quarter. LBJ finished with 25 points, 10 rebounds, five assists, one steal, two triples and six turnovers, and his Cavs are now 6-10 since the new year. Expect the Cavs to be one of the most active teams at the deadline, but LBJ isn't going anywhere.

The Grizzlies are going to unload Tyreke Evans and it's possible Mario Chalmers could also be headed out of town, so Harrison has some stash appeal. His previous two games were solid at 17.0 points, 4.0 boards, 5.5 assists, 0.5 steals and 1.5 treys.

             Olynyk left Monday's game in the first quarter vs. the Magic with what the team labeled a left shoulder strain. He was ruled out shortly thereafter and did not return. Fortunately, it sounds like he avoided a serious injury. There is no MRI scheduled. If Olynyk is unable to play on Wednesday, Hassan Whiteside, Bam Adebayo and James Johnson will likely divvy up additional minutes.
        
        
             Related: Hassan Whiteside, Bam Adebayo
              
             Source: Heat PR on Twitter                                Feb 6 - 1:10 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Seth Curry
                 
                 
                      - G -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Seth Curry (leg) will have season-ending surgery on his left tibia, according to Adrian Wojnarowski? of ESPN.
        
        
             It's been a completely lost season for Curry, who hasn't logged a single minute for the Mavs in 2017-18. According to Woj, Curry's recovery process is expected to take 12-14 weeks, which means he's expected to be fully recovered and on the court by the start of free agency on July 1st. If anybody was still holding onto Curry, he should obviously be sent to the waiver wire in all fantasy formats.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Adrian Wojnarowski? on Twitter              Feb 6 - 1:07 PM

"Zach LaVine
                 
                 
                      - G -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Zach LaVine played 31 minutes again and scored a season-high 27 points with three rebounds, two assists, a steal and four 3-pointers on 9-of-18 shooting on Monday.
        
        
             He also hit 5-of-5 free throws and now that he's getting 30-plus minutes a night, he's an automatic start in fantasy. Since a six-point dud on Jan. 28, LaVine has scored at least 21 points in three straight.

"Bobby Portis

            Bobby Portis hit 7-of-19 shots and two 3-pointers for 18 points, 14 rebounds, four assists, two steals and, of course, zero blocks.
        
        
             That's back-to-back double-doubles for Portis, who is averaging 11.8 points, 10.2 rebounds, 2.2 assists, 0.8 steals and 0.8 3-pointers on 30 percent shooting over his last five. The stats are fine, but the lack of blocks and horrible shooting leave plenty to be desired. He started tonight, but should move back to the bench when Lauri Markkanen (personal) returns on Friday. Either way, Portis is playing well enough to be picked up in most leagues, despite the horrendous shooting. But at least he shot it better tonight after hitting just 8-of-37 shots over his previous three games. He also benefitted tonight by Robin Lopez being ejected after just 13 minutes.

"Ricky Rubio
                 
                 
                      - G -  Jazz

No, he's not really talking about changing his name, but maybe he should. Next year, let someone else draft Rubio, then trade for him in early January, just before he explodes.

             Efficiency usually isn't what Winslow is known for, as he was hitting 40.5% from the field and 65.9% from the line prior to Monday. James Johnson has been eerily quiet for a while and Kelly Olynyk could miss time with a shoulder injury, so we might be seeing more of Winslow going forward. He added eight rebounds, two assists, one steal and one block in 27 minutes, but he'll have a bad taste in his mouth from throwing a sloppy inbounds pass on Miami's final possession. He's a better add in points formats than in category leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 5 - 10:26 PM

             Stephenson started for Victor Oladipo (illness) and played a ton of minutes, but between the poor shooting and turnovers he might have done more damage than good if you had him in your lineup. He's been on a hot streak though and got some extra run with Dipo out tonight, so he deserves some streaming attention as we approach the All-Star break.

Drummond and Blake Griffin look fantastic together and the big man hit 7-of-12 shots for 17 points, 17 rebounds, five assists, a steal and three blocks in 34 minutes, and owners should check back on his status on Tuesday and Wednesday. With the Magic going nowhere this season, AG could miss Thursday's game vs. the Hawks as well, but his status is TBD for that one. Several players will benefit with AG out including Marreese Speights and Mario Hezonja, but Hezonja is the better streaming option.
        
        
             
              
             Source: John Denton on Twitter                            Feb 5 - 11:49 AM

"Steven Adams
                 
                 
                      - C -  Thunder

             The Lakers did a really nice job of keeping Adams off the offensive glass and being forced out to the perimeter to guard Brook Lopez limited his rebounding opportunities on the other end of the floor.             Kyle Lowry scored 11 points on 4-of-11 shooting Sunday to go with three rebounds, one 3-pointer, two assists, two steals and four turnovers in 26 minutes.
        
        
             None of the Raptors' starters played during the fourth quarter on Sunday, and while part of that had to do with the lopsided score, Lowry's minutes were also affected by his lackadaisical effort on defense. Lowry's been struggling with his jumper over the past few weeks, connecting on just 37.1% of his shot attempts, and overall, his numbers have been down across the board this season. He should snap out of the shooting funk at some point, but he might not be much more than top-35 this season.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 4 - 3:18 PM

"DeMarre Carroll
                 
                 
                      - F -  Nets

             Carroll's agent recently hold him that ""a lot of teams are interested"" in trading for the veteran forward. ""[But] they value me a lot [in Brooklyn],"" Carroll said. ""Until somebody calls and Im shipping up out of here, continue to keep playing great basketball for the Brooklyn Nets."" As the second-oldest player on the team, behind Timofey Mozgov, Carroll's role will almost certainly dwindle even if he stays put.

                      - C -  Nets

             The rookie came in averaging 16.0 points on 83.0 percent shooting in his previous three games (all starts), combining bouncy athleticism with tremendous length and impressive finesse for a 19-year-old. ""He gets better with every game and I cant wait until he spends a summer in the weight room and starts to get stronger,"" said coach Kenny Atkinson. ""I think some of those rebounds [he misses], its just a matter of strength."" Congrats if you picked him up while you still could, because he's no longer on the waiver wire in competitive leagues.

"Kyrie Irving
                 
                 
                      - G -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kyrie Irving (right quad contusion) will not play on Sunday vs. Portland.
        
        
             He's out for a third straight game, but the Celtics are calling him day-to-day. ""He feels a lot better,"" coach Brad Stevens said of Irving. ""He had a pretty good workout this morning."" With Shane Larkin (knee) and Marcus Smart (hand) both out as well, Terry Rozier will draw his third straight start. In his last two fill-in starts, Rozier averaged 24.0 points, 9.0 rebounds, 6.0 assists, 2.0 steals and 4.5 triples.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Sean Grande on Twitter                            Feb 4 - 10:16 AM

"Shane Larkin
                 
                 
                      - G -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Shane Larkin (knee) will not play on Sunday vs. the Blazers and coach Brad Stevens said he may be out until the All-Star break.
        
        
             This is Larkin's fourth game in a row on the shelf. With Kyrie Irving (quad) still out and Marcus Smart not expected back for about two weeks, Terry Rozier is once again looking at a heavy workload and is a must-start fantasy option.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Sean Grande on Twitter                            Feb 4 - 10:12 AM

"Tim Hardaway Jr.
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Despite hitting a combined 2-of-24 shots in his last two games, Tim Hardaway Jr. said he's going to keep being aggressive.
        
        
             ""What was I from three-point range? 0-for-9?"" Hardaway said after Friday's 1-of-14 effort vs. the Bucks. ""That says it right there. Im not going to stop shooting. Keep on shooting. There was a lot of wide open ones and there were ones that were questionable here and there. My teammates say keep that thing locked and loaded. Im going to continue to do that."" With a great matchup vs. his former Hawks, his fantasy owners should roll the dice on him Sunday.

The Celtics have another weapon to use in Greg Monroe and we know coach Brad Stevens loves to play the matchup game, so Morris could see a dip in minutes going forward.

"Marvin Williams
                 
                 
                      - F -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marvin Williams (ankle) said he doesn't have a return date in mind.
        
        
             He said his ankle is progressing nicely, but he'll miss his third game in a row on Sunday vs. the Suns. Williams still has some swelling and stiffness, but he did some shooting, footwork drills and ""light jumping"" on Saturday. It doesn't sound like he will play vs. Denver on Monday either, but maybe he can make it back for Thursday vs. the Blazers. Frank Kaminsky has averaged 13.0 points, 4.5 rebounds, 3.5 assists and 1.5 triples in his last two fill-in starts.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Nicolas Batum
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nicolas Batum said Charlotte's ball movement is the reason for his recent success on the court.
        
        
             ""I dont want just plays to score. When you get me involved early in a game, I can do this ball-movement stuff,"" he said. ""Like [Fridays win vs. the Pacers]: I scored, 31 points, but we were moving. There wasnt a lot of one-on-one play. I dont know how many assists we had in the first quarter, but it had to be a lot."" His fantasy owners are loving life right now, as he also had a triple-double vs. the Hawks on Jan. 31 and a 22-point effort vs. the Pacers on Jan. 29. If the Hornets have a quiet trade deadline, that will be good news for Batum.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Charlotte Observer                                Feb 4 - 9:50 AM

                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"James Johnson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Heat coach Erik Spoelstra declined to say how long James Johnson would remain with the second unit.
        
        
             Johnson was in a really bad slump prior to Saturday's game, but responded to his demotion the right way and gave the Heat a spark, finishing with 18 points, five rebounds, seven assists, three 3-pointers and two steals in 29 minutes. ""Everybody will notice if he scores points,"" Heat coach Erik Spoelstra said. ""Its not about that. Its about leadership, his captaincy, No. 1. No. 2, then those defensive inspiring plays."" The move to the second unit may actually be a blessing in disguise, so his fantasy owners should stick with him.

He also chipped in with eight rebounds, two steals, a blocked shot and an assist while going 7-of-12 from the field. Next up is a visit from the Bulls on Monday, the first of three games in the upcoming week.

"Harrison Barnes
                 
                 
                      - F -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Harrison Barnes was good for a team-high 18 points across 34 minutes in Saturday's 106-99 win at Sacramento.
        
        
             Barnes was good for 7-of-14 from the field, including 4-of-8 from behind the 3-point line, and he chipped in with two rebounds, an assist and a steal over 34 minutes. He is averaging 19.2 points over the past five outings, slightly over his season average, but his rebounds have been doing lately and he is working on a four-game streak without a blocked shot. Despite the lack of defensive stats recently he remains useful in most fantasy formats.

"Dwight Powell
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dwight Powell finished with 17 points, nine rebounds, one assist and one steal over 31 minutes in Saturday's 106-99 win at Sacramento.
        
        
             Powell hit 7-of-9 from the field and 3-of-3 from the free-throw stripe. It was his best scoring output since he dropped 21 against Golden State on Jan. 3. He continues to trend in the right direction, averaging 7.7 points, 8.7 rebounds and 1.7 steals per game over the past three outings. He is worth scooping up if you need frontcourt help in competitive fantasy leagues.

"Dirk Nowitzki
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dirk Nowitzki scored 15 points with seven rebounds over 26 minutes in Saturday's win at Sacramento
        
        
             Nowitzki entered the game 32 minutes short of 50,000 minutes for his career, so he needs just six minutes on the road Monday against the Clippers to become the sixth player in NBA history to hit the milestone. ""And you wonder why I move like I've had hip-replacement surgery,"" he joked to teammate Dwight Powell. ""It's just another staggering accomplishment,"" head coach Rick Carlisle added.

"Will Barton
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Will Barton was thrilling during a 115-108 win over the Warriors on Saturday, scoring 25 points with five rebounds, four assists, one steal and three 3-pointers in 35 minutes.
        
        
             What a wild week. Barton missed the last shot in back-to-back losses on Monday and Tuesday, but this time he was the hero today. The Nuggets were down 12 earlier in the game, but a massive 38-point fourth gave them a win in front of their biggest crowd in franchise history at Pepsi Center. Barton is seeing a ridiculous amount of minutes with 38.6 per game over his last five, so that is really helping him become a must-start fantasy asset.

"Raul Neto
                 
                 
                      - G -  Jazz
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Raul Neto stepped up with 12 points across 20 minutes off the bench Saturday at San Antonio.
        
        
             Neto was seeing a little extra run with Donovan Mitchell sidelined, so he took advantage. He was just 3-of-7 from the field, and 0-of-3 from behind the arc, but he drove to the lane several times and made several trips to the free-throw line, finishing 6-of-6 at the stripe. With Mitchell likely back Monday in New Orleans from his illness, Neto will be back to a limited role to squash any temporary fantasy appeal.

"Andrew Wiggins
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Andrew Wiggins hit 7-of-14 shots and a 3-pointer for 15 points on Saturday, but added just three rebounds, one assist and one steal in his 38 minutes of action.
        
        
             He had just seven points on Thursday, but at least added six boards, three steals and a block on a 3-of-10 shooting night in that one. He's been doing a much better job of contributing something other than points on most nights, but Saturday gave us a glimpse of the old Wiggins. Having said that, he's still only ranked as a 13th-round player by Basketballmonster.com on the season. However, over the past month he's been a 10th-round player, meaning he should still be owned everywhere.

            Kevin Durant scored 31 points with six rebounds, seven assists, two blocks and one turnover in 42 minutes against the Nuggets during a 115-108 loss on Saturday.

Center"
"Tobias Harris
                 
                 
                      - F -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tobias Harris looked outstanding in his Clippers debut during a 113-103 win over the Bulls on Saturday, scoring 24 points with four rebounds, two assists and three 3-pointers in 34 minutes.
        
        
             Every time he gets traded, Harris has almost no transition period and once again he looked like he's played for Doc Rivers for years. Harris was able to create his own shot more today and he'll still be asked to take open 3-pointers -- he scored the Clippers' first three points on his first shot. He also saw a lot of post touches in this game and clearly Rivers wants him to score the ball. Harris should be a strong bet to be a top-50 player going forward or maybe even top 30.

            Hassan Whiteside (illness) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. Detroit.

Both Bam Adebayo and Kelly Olynyk will see an uptick in playing time with Whiteside sidelined and are worth considering as streaming options or DFS plays. Adebayo may be inserted into the starting lineup and has intriguing upside, but Olynyk was a more reliable fantasy contributor during Whiteside's extended absence back in December.

"Rodney Stuckey
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Rodney Stuckey is sitting out the 2017-18 campaign but said he plans to make an NBA comeback next season.
        
        
             Stuckey was waived by the Pacers last season, but is not yet ready to call it quits. ""I definitely have a lot of time left in my body,"" said Stuckey, 31, who averaged 12.6 points and 3.6 assists per game in 10 NBA seasons. ""It was just important for me mentally and physically to give my body a rest. I can get back after it next year, and I know I can play another two to three years. Hopefully Ill get the opportunity to do that and then still feel young and be able to run around with my own kids in retirement.""
        
        
             
              
             Source: Seattle Times                                     Feb 3 - 12:11 PM

            E'Twaun Moore went off for 26 points, four rebounds, one assist, one steal and four triples in 32 minutes vs. the Thunder on Friday.
        
        
             Moore is going to benefit from more touches with DeMarcus Cousins (Achilles) out for the season and it's a relief to see him put up a nice line after his 8-point dud in his last game. He was 10-of-14 from the field and solid shooting lines are nothing new, as he hit a blistering 59.8% of his shots in December. He has cooled off since the new year, but he's still worth holding onto.

"Anthony Davis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans

""Those guys put me in position to score. Everybody from guys who were here in my rookie year, to guys here now. Everyone allowed me to get that accomplishment."" He's pretty much unfair in fantasy basketball now that DeMarcus Cousins (Achilles) is done for the season, but as always, it's just a matter of whether or not he can stay healthy.

             Feb 3 - 12:24 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Donovan Mitchell
                 
                 
                      - G -  Jazz
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Donovan Mitchell put on an offensive clinic during a 129-97 win over the Suns on Friday, scoring 40 points in 33 minutes with five rebounds, six assists, two steals and a career-high seven 3-pointers.
        
        
             Goodness. That makes him the first rookie with two 40-point games in a season since Blake Griffin in 2010-11, and he's also the first rookie since Blake to score 30-plus points in at least six games in his first 50 outings. Mitchell also set a Jazz rookie record with those seven treys, and Mitchell has trended up big time there with 2.5 per game in January. In his last 30 games, Mitchell has a 60.1 TS% and a 28.9 usage rate over 34.9 minutes per game. Not only is he among the best rookie scorers in recent memory, the 21-year-old guard is among the best high-volume scorers in the NBA. It's possible Mitchell is looking at early-round fantasy value for the next decade.

             Harkless didn't even attempt a shot and all he had to show for his efforts was one measly assist with a plus-1 rating. The veteran is only used situationally and he rarely sees double-digit minute totals. He can be left to the waiver wire in most fantasy formats.
