Power Forward
Center"
"Taurean Prince
                 
                 
                      - F -  Hawks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Taurean Prince broke out of his slump in Friday's 119-110 loss to Boston, scoring a career-high 31 points in 31 minutes.
        
        
             We told you to hang onto him after a brutal two-game stretch with a combined three points on 1-of-12 shots, so hopefully you stuck with him during the dark times. Prince hit 9-of-17 shots and 8-of-8 from the line in the loss, adding eight rebounds, two assists, three steals and matched his season-high with five triples. The Hawks were going to him over and over in the fourth quarter and hopefully we'll see him build off this performance. With Atlanta expected to have pretty much their entire roster on the trade block, Prince is poised for a big finish.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 2 - 10:03 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Al-Farouq Aminu
                 
                 
                      - F -  Trail Blazers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Al-Farouq Aminu finished with just five points and nine rebounds over 30 minutes in Friday's 130-105 loss at Toronto.
        
        
             Aminu attempted and made just one shot from the field, a 3-pointer, and he didn't have any other defensive stats. Foul trouble wasn't the issue, as he didn't have one personal. He wasn't needed, as Damian Lillard, C.J. McCollum and Jusuf Nurkic were the offensive heroes, going for 20 or more points each. Aminu is averaging just 7.8 points per game over his past four outings, hitting double digits just once.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 2 - 10:01 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Michael Kidd-Gilchrist
                 
                 
                      - F -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Michael Kidd-Gilchrist scored six points with one rebound and two turnovers in 24 minutes against the Pacers on Friday.
        
        
             He lost a lot of run to Michael Carter-Williams, so that's not a good sign. MKG has been just OK in 2018, averaging 11.4 points, 3.8 boards, 1.1 assists, 1.0 steals and 0.7 turnovers in his January games. If you wanted to drop him for a higher-upside guy, it's not a bad idea.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 2 - 9:58 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Victor Oladipo
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Victor Oladipo scored 35 points with five rebounds, two assists, one block, two steals and three 3-pointers in 37 minutes against the Hornets during a 133-126 loss on Friday.
        
        
             He was coming off one of his worst game with seven turnovers and just 13 points on Wednesday, but he turned it around for his first 30-plus scoring game since be returned from his knee injury back on Jan. 6. Oladipo was still really good in that time with 21.6 points per game since and he's been every bit of an All-Star. He'll be in the dunk contest as well.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 2 - 9:54 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Myles Turner
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Myles Turner scored 19 points with 11 rebounds, two assists, one steal, three blocks and one 3-pointer in 32 minutes against the Hornets on Friday.
        
        
             He was very quiet in the fourth quarter, but obviously this line works. Turner had some aggressive boards and even had a put-back dunk over two Hornets, so the knee soreness doesn't look like much of a problem. This makes it three useful games in a row for Turner with a 15-11 and a 22-4 line in his last two while bringing plenty of other stats. There's no doubt he won't meet his ADP on the year, but don't be surprised if Turner puts up early-round value going forward.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 2 - 9:49 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Domantas Sabonis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Domantas Sabonis scored eight points with three rebounds, two assists, one steal, one block and five fouls in 17 minutes against the Hornets on Friday.
        
        
             Last year, we saw Sabonis get into one of the worst fouling slumps of anyone at times and that happened today. Couple that with Myles Turner getting hot, and it is some cause for concern. That said, Sabonis has been too good this season and coach Nate McMillan will be leaning on his two-center lineups. He's a hold in 12-team leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 2 - 9:36 PM

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Lance Stephenson
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Lance Stephenson scored 15 points with one rebound, three assists and three 3-pointers in 23 minutes against the Hornets on Friday.
        
        
             Coach Nate McMillan went small a lot late in this game with the Pacers trailing, so that helped Stephenson take minutes from Thaddeus Young. Stephenson has been about as consistent as he can be, averaging 14.0 points, 3.2 boards, 3.0 assists, 0.4 steals and 1.6 treys on 56.0 percent from the field. He's an OK hold, but inconsistency is likely just around the corner.

                  In-season Projections"
"Terrence Jones
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Terrence Jones is finalizing a 10-day deal with the Pelicans.
        
        
             Since being waived by the Bucks, Jones had a short stint in China and then made his way to the G-League where he's been lighting it up. The Pelicans missed out on the Greg Monroe sweepstakes, but they were able to bring in Nikola Mirotic. Jones can play the four and five and could potentially carve out a nice role up front, but we'll have to see how the Pelicans use him before recommending him as an add. Coach Alvin Gentry thinks Dante Cunningham is a Hall-of-Famer, but Jones is the better player and is worth keeping an eye on.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Shams Charania on Twitter                         Feb 2 - 7:07 PM

Westbrook could have a monster game against the Pelicans tonight.

"Malcolm Brogdon
                 
                 
                      - G -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Malcolm Brogdon has been diagnosed with a partially torn left quadricep tendon and will be out for 6-8 weeks.
        
        
             For the second year in a row, the Bucks get horrible news on a day a key player comes back from injury with Jabari Parker back tonight. Last year on Feb. 8, Parker went down the same night Khris Middleton returned from a torn hamstring. The Bucks could also be without Giannis Antetokounmpo and Eric Bledsoe, so Middleton may be ridiculously busy. Besides him, we'll be seeing more Sterling Brown, Tony Snell, Matt Dellavedova and maybe even Sean Kilpatrick. Brogdon is a drop in most leagues while there really isn't a pickup to make until we get more info on Bledsoe and Giannis.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Matt Velazquez on Twitter                         Feb 2 - 4:24 PM

"Greg Monroe
                 
                 
                      - C -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Greg Monroe will sign with the Boston Celtics, according to Adrian Wojnarowski? of ESPN.
        
        
             This is bad news for those that had stashed Monroe in the hopes that he'd sign with a team that had limited depth at center and plenty of minutes available. For instance, Woj is reporting that the New Orleans Pelicans were offering Monroe the starting center spot, but could only pay him $2.2 million. The Celtics are going to pay him $5.0 million but ""Monroe will join the Celtics with fewer assurances on playing time."" In Boston, Monroe will compete for minutes with Aron Baynes and Daniel Theis behind Al Horford.

"Jamal Murray
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jamal Murray lit up the Thunder during a 127-124 win on Thursday, scoring 33 points with three rebounds, five assists and five 3-pointers in 34 minutes.
        
        
             He submitted his case for ankle-breaker of the year when he dropped Steven Adams for a step-back trey (video in link below). Murray's game has become more well-rounded than ever as he continues to destroy guys off the dribble while adding plenty of treys. In his last seven, he boasts a very nice 69.1 TS% on a 25.1 usage rate, averaging 23.7 points, 4.7 boards, 4.6 assists and 3.3 treys in those seven since returning from a concussion. He's still just 20 years old and he's getting better every day. The breakout is real and it's spectacular.

"Nikola Jokic
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nikola Jokic scored 29 points with 13 rebounds, 14 assists, one steal, two blocks and two 3-pointers in 37 minutes against the Thunder on Thursday.
        
        
             He even had a game-winning assist to get Gary Harris open for the 3-pointer at the buzzer. "Gary Harris
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Gary Harris hit a game-winning 3-pointer at the buzzer to beat the Thunder on Thursday, finishing with 25 points, three rebounds, three assists, one steal and five 3-pointers in 38 minutes.
        
        
             If you missed this game, you may have missed the best game of the year with Harris hitting a deep trey over Russell Westbrook on an ATO with 1.4 seconds left (video in link below). After the game, Harris said he last game winner like that was in pickup ball. He hasn't been used much in the clutch this season with only a 17.0 usage rate during those 54 minutes, but that may change after this. He's having an amazing year in reality and in fantasy with early-round output.

"Russell Westbrook
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Russell Westbrook scored 20 points with nine rebounds, 21 assists, two steals, one block and two 3-pointers in 39 minutes against the Nuggets on Thursday.

Westbrook was burned by Gary Harris for a game-winning three and Nikola Jokic saw that. ""I think Russell fell asleep,"" Jokic said on TNT. After the loss, Westbrook shoved a fan on the court and there's no doubt the league will be looking at this (video in link below). Obviously the fan shouldn't have been there, but the NBA doesn't want its players pushing fans. His fantasy owners will want to make sure he's a go for Friday night because of a possible suspension.

            Jonas Valanciunas scored 17 points with six rebounds, three assists and two 3-pointers in 29 minutes against the Wizards on Thursday.

In those five games, he averaged 18.4 points, 10.8 boards, 2.2 assists, 1.4 blocks and 0.6 treys on 67.8 percent from the field. Plus, he has been bad against the Wizards lately. JV is rolling.

"Blake Griffin
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Blake Griffin's Pistons debut was a successful one during a 104-102 win against the Grizzlies on Thursday, scoring 24 points with 10 rebounds, two blocks, no turnovers and one 3-pointer in 35 minutes.
        
        
             This was a huge win for the Pistons as they basically just had to throw their game plan together on the fly. After the game,  Griffin said the Pistons only ran four plays throughout the night when he was on the floor because those were the main ones they went over in shootaround. It was also surprising that he closed this game out for the final three minutes while Andre Drummond was on the sidelines. You really couldn't ask for much more out of Griffin and he'll be flirting with early-round value as long as he's active.

"Andre Drummond
                 
                 
                      - C -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Andre Drummond scored 14 points, 15 rebounds, three assists, three steals and one block in 28 minutes against the Grizzlies on Thursday.
        
        
             We did get a surprise down the stretch with Anthony Tolliver closing over Drummond for basically the last 3:09 -- Drummond was in for a couple rebounding chances on free throws. Perhaps most notably, Drummond was not on the court for the biggest defensive play of the game when the Grizzlies had the ball down one with 20 seconds left. He did look comfortable with Blake Griffin and even had a dunk off a Griffin dime, but Drummond may take a hit with Blake around. Perhaps the craziest stat on Drummond's adjustment is how 58 percent of his assists went to Tobias Harris or Avery Bradley before the trade. To be clear, Drummond is still going to be a monster.

"Stanley Johnson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stanley Johnson scored 14 points with three rebounds, three assists, one steal and two 3-pointers in 36 minutes against the Grizzlies on Thursday.
        
        
             He had one of the biggest plays of the game with a steal that led to a Johnson assist on an Andre Drummond dunk to tie the game at 94. Johnson did make his mistakes earlier in the game, but coach Stan Van Gundy seems to trust him for now. We'll see if the Pistons do shop Johnson and maybe there's a market for him after this game and a 26-point Tuesday. He's not a must-add grab based on how he was a ghost for the first three months of the season, but give him a look to see if he magically fixed himself. Stranger things have happened.

Anthony Davis said he's ""OK"" playing center, but maybe he doesn't want to play exclusively at that spot. Monroe is probably going to come off the bench and he could be looking at minutes in the low 20s. He's worth an add in most formats, but he doesn't offer the upside like some of the other red-hot pickups like Jarrett Allen or even Wayne Selden. Plus, the Celtics could swoop in and land him, which would destroy his fantasy value.

"Brook Lopez
                 
                 
                      - C -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            After playing just nine minutes against the Magic on Wednesday and not playing in the fourth, Brook Lopez said that he covered his face with a towel in the middle of the fourth to vent and hide his emotions.
        
        
             ""I mean, especially on the court, I can be very visible, with my emotions [showing on my face],"" Lopez said about not playing in the fourth. ""So yeah, just trying to control myself, breathe a little bit, and just keep cool because it was an unfortunate game for us."" This makes it the 16th time in the last 18 games he didn't play in the fourth, so this is a clear trend. Lopez finished with just nine minutes and he's a drop candidate these days. Maybe a trade can save him.

"Nikola Mirotic
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Pelicans have finalized a deal for Nikola Mirotic according to ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.
        
        
             The Pelicans are also planning to guarantee the $12.5M salary of Mirotic for the 2018-19 season, so this isn't just a rental. New Orleans will send Chicago a 2018 first-round pick with ""minimal"" protections in addition to Tony Allen, Jameer Nelson and Omer Asik. The Pelicans cleared a roster spot with this move, opening the door for them to also bring in Greg Monroe. This is a solid landing spot for Mirotic and he will give the Pelicans some much needed floor spacing to open things up for Anthony Davis. He's definitely worth owning in standard leagues.

            Blake Griffin will make his first appearance with the Pistons on Thursday night vs. Memphis.
        
        
             Griffin will enter the starting lineup alongside Ish Smith, Reggie Bullock, Stanley Johnson and Andre Drummond. Coach Stan Van Gundy said he would like to stagger Griffin and Drummond so that at least one of them is always on the floor, and that's also good news for their fantasy value. He'll immediately become the go-to option on offense.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Nick Friedell on Twitter                          Feb 1 - 11:50 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats

"Myles Turner
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Myles Turner is questionable for Friday's game vs. the Hornets with a sore right knee.
        
        
             He did have some soreness in the same knee in early December, but he didn't miss any time. The injuries are really starting to pile up for Turner and he's now had issues with his knee, elbow, thigh and calf to go with a concussion this season. If he can't play, Domantas Sabonis would benefit the most and slide into the starting lineup.

"Joe Johnson
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Rockets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Joe Johnson ""is angling behind the scenes"" for a trade out of Utah according to Marc Stein of the New York Times.
        
        
             The Jazz are three losses behind the No. 8 seed in Denver, so their playoff hopes are still very much alive. However, they aren't close to being a contender right now and Johnson is no spring chicken. If the Jazz are unable to find him a new home, he could very easily become a buyout candidate. A move to a contender wouldn't be great news for his fantasy value, but he's not a 12-team asset anyways.

"Greg Monroe

            There is ""strong, early mutual interest"" between the Pelicans and Greg Monroe according to Chris Mannix of Yahoo Sports.
        
        
             This makes a lot of sense for both sides. Monroe is a New Orleans native and could see significant minutes as a DeMarcus Cousins (Achilles) replacement. Assuming he clears waivers, the Pelicans will be one of many teams knocking on his door. ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski said the Celtics are also a potential destination and can use part of their $8.4 million disabled player exception from the Gordon Hayward (leg) injury. In terms of fantasy, a move to New Orleans would be better for his fantasy value.

"Josh Jackson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Josh Jackson matched his career-high 21 points with eight rebounds, two assists, two steals, one block and one 3-pointer in 28 minutes against the Mavs as a starter at shooting guard on Wednesday.
        
        
             The lineup move was a big success and coach Jay Triano really seems to be coming around on Jackson. Earlier this week, he said he liked how he produced offense in the open floor and he likes how he attacks the basket. Of course, the key to Jackson's minutes will be his defense, and he had that in spades today with great isolation and PNR defense. He's playing well enough to add in most standard leagues, but just know he'll probably have some bad games mixed in going forward.

                  In-season Projections"
"Terry Rozier
                 
                 
                      - G -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Terry Rozier turned in a triple-double in his first NBA start during a 103-73 win over the Knicks on Wednesday, scoring 17 points with 11 rebounds, 10 assists, two steals, two blocks and three 3-pointers in 33 minutes.
        
        
             He's just the second player in the last 40 seasons to drop a triple-double in his first career NBA start -- usage-rate stud Tony Wroten will live on forever. Rozier also matched Kyrie Irving's one triple-double in his career, and it's possible Irving misses additional time with how well Rozier played. After the game, Rozier did joke that he'll give Irving his job back when he's ready, but he said he wants to be a starter. ""Not trying to toot my own horn or anything because I got a triple-double in my first start but thats what I truly believe and thats my goal,"" Rozier said. He should clean up while Irving and Marcus Smart are out.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Chris Forsberg on Twitter                         Feb 1 - 1:04 AM

"C.J. McCollum
                 
                 
                      - G -  Trail Blazers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            C.J. McCollum erupted for a career-high 50 points vs. Chicago on Wednesday, making 18-of-25 FGs and 8-of-8 FTs with six 3-pointers, five rebounds, two assists and one steal in just 29 minutes.
        
        
             McCollum scored 28 points in the first quarter alone, which was the most ever scored in a single quarter against the Bulls. He also broke Damian Lillard's single-quarter scoring record for the Blazers, and might have gone for 60+ if this game wasn't a complete blowout. He's the seventh player in franchise history with at least 50 points in a game, joining Lillard, Clyde Drexler, Geoff Petrie, Andre Miller, Brandon Roy and Damon Stoudamire. He's held top-50 roto value all season and is about as steady as they come for fantasy purposes.

"Joakim Noah
                 
                 
                      - C -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Joakim Noah will not be required to return to the Knicks prior to the Feb. 8 trade deadline, according Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.com.
        
        
             Noah was sent away after a practice confrontation with Jeff Hornacek on Jan. 24, so obviously the Knicks aren't in a rush to bring him back. They won't be getting anything of value for him as they try to figure out ways to get him off their roster.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Adrian Wojnarowski on Twitter                     Jan 31 - 8:16 PM

"Tyreke Evans
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Grizzlies plan to sit Tyreke Evans out until a deal is completed, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.com.
        
        
             He is not going to play tonight and his time in Memphis is over. That means the Grizzlies will have to go crazy with Wayne Selden, Andrew Harrison and eventually get Kobi Simmons back in the mix. Evans' fantasy owners should be rooting for a trade to Washington because a trade to Philly, Houston or Boston would destroy his fantasy value. That sell-high window just slammed shut.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Adrian Wojnarowski on Twitter                     Jan 31 - 6:33 PM

"Mason Plumlee
                 
                 
                      - C -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Mason Plumlee (right calf strain) has been ruled out for Thursday's game against the Thunder.
        
        
             This is the second game in a row that Plumlee will be ruled out a full 24 hours before tip-off, which suggests he's not close at all. Darell Arthur got the start in his place on Tuesday and finished with 10 points, three boards, one 3-pointer, two assists, one steal, one block and one turnover in 19 minutes, so he'll be on the deep league radar if he can stick as a starter on Thursday.
        
        
             Related: Darrell Arthur

                  In-season Projections"
"DeMarcus Cousins
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            DeMarcus Cousins underwent successful surgery to repair his torn left Achilles on Wednesday and he will miss the remainder of the 2017-18 season.
        
        
             The Pelicans haven't yet released a firm timetable on Boogie, but generally speaking, these sort of injuries take 6-10 months to recover from so in a worst-case scenario he might not be ready for the start of the 2018-19 season. Unfortunately, Achilles injuries can be career altering ordeals, and Cousins' size could complicate the issue. He'll be a risky guy to draft next season.
        
        
             
              
             Source: New Orleans Pelicans on Twitter                   Jan 31 - 6:12 PM

"Aaron Gordon
                 
                 
                      - F -  Magic
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Aaron Gordon (hip) will not play against the Lakers on Wednesday and Marreese Speights will start in his place.
        
        
             Well, this is an interesting move with Speights getting a start. Gordon's hip injury didn't look bad this weekend, but now he'll miss his second straight game. He should be considered questionable for Saturday against the Wizards. Mario Hezonja and Speights are risky plays while Khem Birch should get the backup center minutes.RotoGrinders.com Daily Slant: Speights actually leads the Magic in usage rate with Gordon and all other inactive/non-rotation members off the floor. He holds a healthy 30.2% usage with a 0.96 FPPM mark, and if he's able to come close to matching those totals in a spot-start, he should have a nice shot at exceeding value. Mario Hezonja should still see ample run off the bench.

Griffin has held his high usage rate in almost any situation, so his fantasy owners shouldn't expect a drop off once he figures out the offense.

Evans has also been linked to Boston, New Orleans, Miami, OKC and Houston, and it seems likely that he won't finish the year in Memphis. He's in an ideal situation in Memphis, so owners may want to sell-high before he gets dealt.

             He missed his season high in scoring by one point, and that came five games ago when he had 21 against the Clippers on Jan. 20. Ingles was a tough pill to swallow for a stretch of the season, but is rolling right now, averaging 14.6 points, 2.4 rebounds, 3.2 assists, 1.8 steals and 3.6 3-pointers on 56 percent shooting over his last five games. He's benefitting from the absence of Rodney Hood (leg), but is still worth a pickup while he's this hot.

             Jan 31 - 12:00 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"James Harden
                 
                 
                      - G -  Rockets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            James Harden hit 19-of-30 shots, 5-of-14 3-pointers and 17-of-18 free throws on his way to 60 points, 10 rebounds, 11 assists, four steals and a block, marking the first time in NBA history that a player has had a 60-point triple-double.
        
        
             He scored 18 points in the fourth quarter and broke Calvin Murphy's franchise scoring record of 57 points, which he set in 1978. Murphy was also on hand to witness it and was shown cheering Harden's accomplishment. This was his third triple-double of the season and he could be primed to continue to go off for the rest of the week, as Chris Paul and Trevor Ariza were out for this one, and Eric Gordon left with back stiffness. Lastly, Harden played a season-high 46 minutes and 26 seconds, racked up his fourth 50-point game of the season, and set his own career high, which was previously 56 points. Big game, James!

James Harden's 60-point triple-double just might have done some damage to Payton's short-term future in Orlando, although it also may not have hurt him at all.

"Stanley Johnson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stanley Johnson erupted for a career-high 26 points in a 125-114 win over the Cavaliers on Tuesday, hitting  10-of-21 shots and 5-of-8 free throws in 40 minutes.
        
        
             After the game, coach Stan Van Gundy gushed about him and said it was the best he's seen him play. Johnson also tied his career-high with 10 rebounds, adding four assists, two steals, one block, one triple and four turnovers. It's worth noting that Cleveland has the worst defensive rating in the NBA and Blake Griffin wasn't available for his Pistons debut, but SVG did say that one of the reasons he liked the trade was because it opened up minutes for guys like Johnson. It's hard not to take a flier on him after a game like this.

Center"
"Dante Cunningham
                 
                 
                      - F -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dante Cunningham started for the Pelicans on Tuesday but was replaced by Cheick Diallo in the second half due to a back injury and never returned to the game.
        
        
             Cunningham wasn't a must-own player, by any means, to begin with and Omer Asik played 24 minutes off the bench tonight, finishing with one point, four rebounds, a steal, a block and five fouls. Asik isn't a guy we're necessarily interested in picking up either, and Diallo played just six minutes. Darius Miller still looks like the pickup in the wake of DeMarcus Cousins' injury and he scored 10 points with two 3-pointers in 29 minutes tonight.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 30 - 10:51 PM

                  In-season Projections"
"D'Angelo Russell
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            D'Angelo Russell returned from a rest day to score seven points in 20 minutes.
        
        
             D Russ added five rebounds, one assist, one steal, one block and two turnovers, but he's still just a shell of himself since returning from his injury. In his last five outings, Russell has more turnovers (15) than assists (8) and is shooting a combined 12-of-41 from the field. It makes a lot of sense to leave him on your bench until he heats up.

                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Jarrett Allen
                 
                 
                      - C -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jarrett Allen made his first career start on Tuesday vs. the Knicks, scoring 12 points with four rebounds and two turnovers in 20 minutes.
        
        
             He got off to a really rough start by allowing Kristaps Porzingis a couple quick 3-pointers, but did settle down as the game progressed. The Nets were absolutely killed on the glass and it's fair to put some of that blame on Allen, but he did show a nice touch on the offensive end and made all six of his shots. Tyler Zeller was a DNP-CD and Jahlil Okafor played 25 minutes, so it would be great news for Allen's outlook if they continue to play just two centers. Despite tonight's underwhelming line, he's worth a look as a stash if you're targeting rebounds, blocks and FG percentage.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 30 - 10:44 PM

"Anthony Davis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Anthony Davis hit 6-of-16 shots, 2-of-3 3-pointers and 9-of-10 free throws for 23 points, 13 rebounds, five assists, a steal and six blocks in 36 minutes of Tuesday's 114-103 loss to the Kings.
        
        
             Davis was a monster tonight and this game just makes us sad that DeMarcus Cousins didn't get to play, as he would have tried to destroy his former team and help the Pelicans get to the playoffs. As for Davis, you're looking at the No. 2 player in nine-cat this season, and he might be getting even better.

"Fred VanVleet
                 
                 
                      - G -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Fred VanVleet was able to take care of his family and his newborn child, skip shootaround and overcome a doubtful label to play on Tuesday night.
        
        
             Props to the Raptors for giving him the day off to be with his family and props to FVV for going to work when he really didn't have to. The Raptors won and he finished with 10 points, two rebounds, two assists and a 3-pointer in 21 minutes, once again easily outplaying Delon Wright. The Raptors visit the Wizards on Thursday, so it's likely that FVV will make the trip to Washington.

"Frank Ntilikina
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Frank Ntilikina scored eight points with five assists, one steal and two 3-pointers vs. the Nets on Tuesday.
        
        
             Jarrett Jack (two points in 20 minutes) and Trey Burke (two points in 17 minutes) were ineffective tonight, but this was  Ntilikina's first good game in a while. He hit 3-of-7 shots, missed his only free throw and had a pair of turnovers, but this was at least a step in the right direction. He's a potential stash with the trade deadline looming, and he'll benefit if the Knicks are sellers.

                  In-season Projections"
"Enes Kanter
                 
                 
                      - C -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Enes Kanter scored 20 points with 20 rebounds, five assists, two blocks and four turnovers in an easy win over the Nets on Tuesday.
        
        
             The Nets have allowed the most fantasy points to centers this season and Kanter took advantage of his matchup with an undersized Quincy Acy with Jarrett Allen focusing on Kristaps Porzingis. He scored 20 points for the third game in a row and this was his fourth career game with 20+ rebounds. He's having a career season in New York and has been on an absolute tear over his last three games, averaging 20.0 points and 12.3 rebounds on a combined 25-of-33 shots. His owners will be hoping for a quiet trade deadline.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 30 - 10:27 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Jonas Valanciunas
                 
                 
                      - C -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jonas Valanciunas hit 8-of-12 shots and both of his free throws on his way to 18 points, 11 rebounds, one assist and a steal in Tuesday's win over the Timberwolves.
        
        
             JV has been incredibly frustrating to own at times this season, perhaps never as much as when he failed to score a point and had three rebounds in 11 minutes on Jan. 20. However, since then he's been on fire, averaging 18.8 points, 12.0 rebounds and 1.8 blocks over his last four games and double-doubling in all of them. With all the big men and NBA players in general dropping like flies right, Valanciunas suddenly looks like a guy you want to own going forward.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Kristaps Porzingis
                 
                 
                      - F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kristaps Porzingis dominated in a 111-95 win over the Nets on Tuesday with 28 points, five rebounds, two assists, one steal, two blocks and six triples.
        
        
             The six triples set a new career-high, and it was just a matter of time with 16 career games with 4+ triples. He finished 9-of-19 from the field and hit all four free throws in 30 minutes, helping the Knicks win their second straight game. When asked about the upcoming trade deadline, Porzingis said he was in favor of adding a veteran piece to help the Knicks reach the postseason. ""Playoff experience for myself, individually, would be huge at this point in my career -- the sooner, the better."" A competitive Knicks team would be great for Porzingis' value down the stretch.
        
        
             
              
             Source: ESPN                                              Jan 30 - 10:13 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Karl-Anthony Towns
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Karl-Anthony Towns hit just 4-of-7 shots for 11 points, 10 rebounds, three assists, zero steals and zero blocks in Tuesday's loss to the Raptors.
        
        
             Towns has scored 16 or fewer points in four of his last five games, but he's still racking up rebounds, steals, blocks and 3-pointers on most nights, still hasn't missed a game this season, and is still the No. 8 fantasy player in nine-cat leagues. Don't be frightened by the fact KAT was outplayed by Jonas Valanciunas tonight. He's actually played very well in four straight games, proving that miracles do happen.

"Otto Porter
                 
                 
                      - F -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Otto Porter hit 8-of-13 shots, a 3-pointer and 8-of-8 free throws for 25 points, six rebounds, three assists, two steals, a block and just one turnover in 34 minutes on Tuesday.
        
        
             With John Wall out indefinitely, Porter, Bradley Beal, Markieff Morris and Tomas Satoransky are all going to have to step up, and they did just that tonight. Porter went to the locker room with a minor head injury for about five minutes, but it doesn't appear to be a big deal. He was great tonight.

"Paul George
                 
                 
                      - F -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Paul George hit 8-of-14 shots, four 3-pointers and 8-of-10 free throws on his way to 28 points, six rebounds and nothing else in a 102-96 loss to the Wizards.
        
        
             Russell Westbrook and Carmelo Anthony hit a combined 12-of-39 shots, so George's efficiency, along with that of Steven Adams, who hit 6-of-11 shots for 16 points and 12 rebounds, kept the Thunder in the game until the end. Washington pulled away in the final minutes though, and the Thunder will try to regroup in time for Thursday's date with the Nuggets.

Center"
"Russell Westbrook
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Russell Westbrook hit just 5-of-18 shots and 1-of-4 3-pointers for 13 points, six rebounds, 10 assists, four steals and seven turnovers in a 102-96 loss to the Wizards, who were without John Wall.
        
        
             Tomas Satoransky and Tim Frazier both did a nice job on Westy defensively tonight, and this wasn't his worst game of the season, as he's had several games that garnered fewer points and more missed shots than he had tonight. Westbrook had scored between 31 and 46 points in each of his last four games, so maybe he was just due for an off night. He'll bounce back against the Nuggets on Thursday. Carmelo Anthony wasn't much better, hitting just 7-of-21 shots on the night, as the Thunder saw their eight-game winning streak come to an end.
        
        
             Related: Carmelo Anthony

"Kevin Love
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            X-rays revealed that Kevin Love suffered a non-displaced fracture of the fifth metacarpal in his left hand on Tuesday and will be out indefinitely.
        
        
             ESPN's Brian Windhorst is reporting that this will be a 6-8 week recovery time for Love, so this is pretty devastating news. As if things weren't going bad enough for the Cavs and Love, they'll now be looking to guys like Jeff Green, Tristan Thompson, Channing Frye and Jae Crowder to step up in Love's absence. And what it really probably means is that the Cavs are going to be very busy this trade season trying to get a piece that will help fix their broken puzzle.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Dave McMenamin on Twitter                         Jan 30 - 9:16 PM

James Harden is currently going bonkers, but look for Gerald Green to get an opportunity if Gordon's back injury lingers this week.

"Jarrett Allen
                 
                 
                      - C -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jarrett Allen will replace Tyler Zeller in the starting lineup for Tuesday's game against the Knicks.
        
        
             This will be Allen's first career start and he'll be joined by Spencer Dinwiddie, Allen Crabbe, DeMarre Carroll and Quincy Acy. Allen is loaded with upside, and it's telling that he'll get a crack at the starting five spot before Jahli Okafor does. Allen could carve out some standard league value if he could just get his minutes consistently in the 25-range, and starting is the first step to that happening. He's certainly worth a speculative add in deep leagues.

"George Hill
                 
                 
                      - G -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The trade that would have sent George Hill to Cleveland was held up because the Cavs wanted Hill to agree to a buyout if LeBron James left as a free agent next summer.
        
        
             ""George Hill, they didnt want to buy him out this year,"" said Brian Windhorst of ESPN. ""What they wanted to do was protect themselves in the event that, if LeBron James left, whether George Hill would be willing to take a buyout on the $20 million hes owed on his contract after this season."" Essentially the Cavs asked Hill to sacrifice $20 million in guaranteed money if LBJ opted to leave, and Hill wasn't feeling that. Anything could happen, but at this point, a trade seems unlikely.
        
        
             Related: Cavaliers
              
             Source: ESPN                                              Jan 30 - 5:19 PM

                Career Stats

"Blake Griffin
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stan Van Gundy acknowledged Blake Griffin's injury history on Tuesday but said that bringing in a five-time All-Star was worth the risk for a franchise that has struggled to bring in top-tier talent.
        
        
             ""Our thinking was this: The hardest thing to do in this league is to get a proven star,"" Van Gundy said. ""The guy's a five-time All-Star. He's been an All-NBA guy, [one of] top 15 guys in the league. He's only 28 years old. We know the injury history -- that's the risk on it. But that risk was worth it because of the talent we're bringing back."" While Griffin will not play on Tuesday, there's a good chance he'll be able to make his Pistons' debut on Thursday against the Grizzlies.
        
        
             
              
             Source: ESPN                                              Jan 30 - 4:49 PM

"Nikola Mirotic
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nikola Mirotic will reportedly be traded to the New Orleans Pelicans in exchange for Omer Asik and a first-round draft pick, according to Vincent Goodwill of NBC Sports Chicago.
        
        
             We're still waiting to get confirmation from additional sources. The Pelicans would obviously like to upgrade their frontcourt following the loss of DeMarcus Cousins. However, sacrificing a first-round pick for Mirotic would be a steep price to pay. If the trade does go through, it will increase the fantasy value of Mirotic, who would likely join the starting lineup in New Orleans. It would also boost the value of Lauri Markkanen and Bobby Portis in Chicago, as it would clear out the logjam in the Bulls frontcourt.

            Coach Fred Hoiberg said he was unsure if Nikola Mirotic (lower left leg strain) will fly with the team to Portland for Wednesday's game vs. the Blazers.
        
        
             Mirotic has been absent from practice on Monday and Tuesday. Hoiberg declined to give specifics on the injury or Mirotic's status for Wednesday. The Bulls fly to Portland on Tuesday night, so we may know whether or not he gets on the plane. Lauri Markkanen (personal) has also missed practice each of the last two days and is questionable for Wednesday. Bobby Portis could be in line for a start and major minutes Wednesday vs. the Blazers.
        
        
             Related: Bobby Portis
              
             Source: Mike McGraw on Twitter                            Jan 30 - 12:35 PM

"John Wall
                 
                 
                      - G -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            John Wall will undergo a ""clean up"" procedure on his left knee on Wednesday and will be sidelined for 6-8 weeks.
        
        
             Wall did not play Sunday after it was revealed that he was dealing with a recurrence of soreness and swelling in his left knee. Wall flew to Cleveland on Monday to get a second opinion from the doctor who performed his original knee surgery in 2016. A decision has now been made to have the knee scoped. The first report from The Washington Post indicated that Wall would miss six weeks. However, Woj tweeted out that Wall could be sidelined for two months. Tomas Satoransky and Tim Frazier will divvy up minutes at point guard in Wall's absence.
        
        
             Related: Tomas Satoransky, Tim Frazier

"Josh Richardson
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Josh Richardson put on a show for his parents, who had great seats in Dallas on Monday, hitting 4-of-8 shots and 4-of-7 3-pointers for 14 points, three rebounds, three assists, two steals and a career-high four blocks in 38 minutes of Monday's win over Dallas.
        
        
             Richardson got off to a slow start this season, but is cooking nowadays. He's played at least 31 minutes in every game since Dec. 30 and has played at least 34 minutes in each of his last seven. He's returning fourth-round fantasy value over the past month and with all the minutes he's getting, he's going to stay right there, if not improve.

            Troy Daniels (back) made his third straight start on Monday vs. the Grizzlies, scoring nine points in 23 minutes.
        
        
             Daniels hit 2-of-8 from the field (both 3-pointers) with one rebound, one steal and one block. We now have a decent sample size to work with, and it's clear that he's strictly a 3-point specialist for deep-league owners right now -- he's averaging 7.6 points, 1.0 rebounds and 2.0 triples in his last three starts.

Simmons still can't shoot more than 5-8 feet from the hoop, so creating his own shot gets a little tougher without Joel.              Anderson was also yanked in the fourth quarter after San Antonio gave up a quick pair of 3-pointers to George Hill and Vince Carter. He didn't re-enter the game until garbage time, and it looks like Gregg Popovich was sending him a message. Anderson has been raking in the defensive stats as mid-round roto value for the past month, so owners shouldn't overreact.

             Melo's role might be tweaked in the wake of Andre Roberson's season-ending knee injury, as the Thunder look to compensate defensively. He could play more SF with the second unit, with Jerami Grant or Patrick Patterson at PF, but it's just something to watch over the next few games. He's settled into a nice groove the past few weeks, averaging 20.0 points on 47.4% FGs and 100.0% FTs, with 6.8 rebounds, 2.0 triples, 1.4 assists and 1.0 steals.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Fred Katz on Twitter                              Jan 28 - 9:34 PM

"Josh Jackson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Josh Jackson shot 0-of-13 from the field on Sunday, scoring two points with four rebounds and one turnover in 22 minutes.
        
        
             According to Basketball-Reference, Jackson is the 21st player since 1963-64 to attempt at least 13 shots without a single make. He's also just the fourth bench player to hit that dubious mark, joining Derrick Favors (2012), Dino Radja (1993) and Junior Bridgeman (1984). His game was distinguished by historically poor efficiency, in other words, and Jackson has a lot to prove to fantasy owners even if his role balloons down the stretch for Phoenix.

                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Anthony Davis finished Sunday's 112-103 loss against the Clippers with 25 points, 17 rebounds and six assists across 41 minutes.
        
        
             A.D. begins life after DeMarcus Cousins with a bang, also adding two steals and a blocked shot. He also became the franchise's all-time leader in rebounds (3,857), passing David West. It wasn't all great for Davis, as he appeared to tweak his groin near the end of the game on an awkward fall, so it's something to watch. He has had a propensity for injury in the past. With Cousins on the mend, Davis will put up monster nights like this as long as he can stay at 100 percent health.

"Devin Booker

            Devin Booker popped off for 31 points, 10 assists, five 3-pointers, three rebounds and three turnovers in 41 minutes on Sunday, but left the game during the closing seconds with an injury.

He was in some obvious discomfort after the game and told Suns' beat reporter Scott Bordow that he's scheduled to undergo X-rays on his left hip/ribs area in Memphis, so for now, it seems unlikely that he'll be able to get out there on Monday night. If Booker sits, Tyler Ulis would likely return to the starting five with T.J. Warren and Josh Jackson seeing an uptick in usage.

His rest-of-season value looks safe no matter what the Bulls do at the trade deadline.

            Reggie Bullock will move back into the starting lineup on Sunday vs. Cleveland, sending Stanley Johnson back to the second unit.

             Teague was 0-of-4 from the field, and his only points came as a result of a 2-of-2 night from the charity stripe. He was able to add four assists, two rebounds and a steal, but it was a far cry from the season-high 30 points he dropped earlier in the week against the Clippers. The return of Jimmy Butler (knee) certainly didn't do him any favors.

"Jimmy Butler
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jimmy Butler (knee) returned to the lineup on Saturday night against the Nets, finishing with 21 points across 35 minutes.
        
        
             Butler wasn't playing with any kind of a minutes cap in his return to action. He hit 4-of-14 from the field, including 1-of-3 from behind the arc, and most of his damage came from the free-throw stripe. It appears safe to get him back into the active fantasy lineup, and he faces a four-game schedule in the upcoming week.

                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Gary Harris
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Gary Harris scored 24 points with four rebounds, four assists, two steals and three 3-pointers during a 91-89 win over the Mavs on Saturday.
        
        
             He's one of the most aggressive defenders in the NBA, but his offense is starting to catch up to his defense. It's not the hottest take to say he's the best finisher at the rim among guards with a flashy finish almost every night. Plus, he's made 74 percent at the rim to put him in LeBron James territory -- James has an incredible 77% at rim -- and Harris crushes Kyrie Irving's 63% within three feet. Harris is going to be a fantasy stud for a long time.

                  In-season Projections"
"Stephen Curry
                 
                 
                      - G -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stephen Curry scored a season-high 49 points during an exciting 109-105 win over the Celtics on Saturday, adding four rebounds, five assists, two steals and eight 3-pointers on 16-of-24 from the field and 9-of-10 from the line.
        
        
             He has to be in the MVP conversation now. Since he's returned from injury, he is on one of the biggest heaters of all time among high-volume players. In those 12 games, he has a 30.1 usage rate and an unbelievable 75.0 TS% in 34.0 minutes per game. In simpler terms, he's averaged 31.5 points, 5.3 boards, 6.5 assists, 1.5 steals and 5.9 treys in those dozen contests. Curry is also knocking on the door of a 50/40/90 with his 49.8/43.0/90.9 on the season. He'll go down as one of the best offensive weapons in NBA history.

             The triples were the good news. The bad news is Prince finished with a dismal minus-29 rating, by far the worst mark for the losing side. He is averaging 13.5 points per game over his past four outings, and he has 2.05 3-pointers per game across his past 21 appearances. Prince should continue to shoulder a heavy load down the stretch for the Hawks.

"Tim Frazier
                 
                 
                      - G -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tim Frazier finished with four points, 14 assists and three blocked shots over 27 minutes in Saturday's victory at Atlanta.
        
        
             Frazier became the first bench player in NBA history to record at least 14 assists and three blocked shots since blocks were first tracked in 1973-74, according to Elias Sports Bureau. And they're the most by a Wizards reserve since Muggsy Bogues doled out 14 dimes in 1988. He had managed a total of six assists from Dec. 23-Jan. 25 in just three appearances, so he certainly took advantage of the extra run with John Wall sidelined due to a sore left knee.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Clevis Murray on Twitter                          Jan 27 - 10:50 PM

            Andre Drummond scored 12 points with 13 rebounds, two assists, one steal and three blocks in 31 minutes against the Thunder on Saturday.
        
        
             He was also just 2-of-6 from the line today, which marked just the fourth time he's been under 40 percent from the line in a game when attempting at least five freebies. Drummond is also seeing a nice upward trend in his blocks, boards and steals. He's been a fantasy stud now that he's not killing FT%.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 27 - 8:10 PM

"Tobias Harris
                 
                 
                      - F -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tobias Harris scored 21 points with three rebounds, one assist, one steal and two 3-pointers in 32 minutes against the Thunder on Saturday.
        
        
             He's been one of the most quietly consistent players in the NBA as he just coasts to averages of 18 points, five boards, two dimes and 2.3 treys per night. Harris won't be winning you a league with his output alone, but he's not going to hurt you either.

                      - G -  Clippers

             He's a mess on offense this year. Bradley is way below average on finishing at the rim while he's been somewhat effective when he's wide open on 3-pointers. Coach Stan Van Gundy probably needs to cater the offense to him more, but that's probably not going to happen. He's been one of the biggest busts in fantasy, but there's still some hope.

"Andre Roberson
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Preliminary reports on Andre Roberson are that he ruptured his patellar tendon, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.com.
        
        
             Awful news. This will mean three NBA players would be out for the season based on the news in the last 24 hours (Conley, Cousins). Patellar tendon surgery has a difficult rehab and Roberson is going to have a tough time being ready for the start of next season. The Thunder will have to lean on Terrance Ferguson, Alex Abrines and Josh Huestis more now with Ferguson deserving a fantasy look in deeper leagues.

"Anthony Davis

As you might expect, Davis' per 36 minute stats with Cousins off the court this season are impressive (431-minute sample): 29.3 points, 13.7 boards, 4.3 dimes, 2.6 blocks, 1.5 steals and 0.8 treys on a 33.3 usage rate.                   In-season Projections"
"DeMarcus Cousins
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Pelicans announced DeMarcus Cousins has suffered a rupture to his left Achilles tendon.
        
        
             This confirms the multiple reports from Friday night. He will have surgery, miss the rest of this season, and he's reportedly expected to have a 6-10 month rehab. Cousins is also entering free agency this summer at age 27 and this could affect his market. He's 27 years old and bigs like Elton Brand fell off in a big way after a rupture, so Boogie has a huge hill to climb -- Brand was 28 when he tore his in 2007. It'll also be very interesting to see how the Pelicans approach the playoff race for the remainder of this season.

"D'Angelo Russell
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            D'Angelo Russell (rest) will not play against the Wolves on Saturday.
        
        
             The team is calling it ""return from injury management"" and it's not a surprise he's not playing in a back-to-back set yet. Russell continues to look extremely rusty as a scorer, and his seven turnovers in 21 minutes on Friday were almost inexcusable. For tonight, Caris LeVert is a big winner while Joe Harris, Allen Crabbe and DeMarre Carroll also benefit.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 27 - 2:07 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Mike Conley
                 
                 
                      - G -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Grizzlies announced on Saturday that Mike Conley will undergo season-ending surgery to ""smooth a small bone protrusion"" in his left heel.
        
        
             Although the news isn't shocking, considering the Grizzlies have essentially already been eliminated from playoff contention, it's still obviously a tough blow for Memphis fans and Conley owners. GM Chris Wallace said that Conley ""has been extremely diligent as we pursued multiple different approaches to alleviate the pain before deciding surgery was the best solution."" Conley hasn't played since early November, but made some progress in his rehab. However, the ""pain/soreness persisted."" Conley is expected to make a full recovery prior to 2018-19 training camp. Andrew Harrison and Mario Chalmers will continue to divvy up minutes at point guard.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Michael Wallace on Twitter                        Jan 27 - 1:45 PM

                  In-season Projections"
"Isaiah Whitehead
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Nets have recalled Isaiah Whitehead from their G-League affiliate.
        
        
             After appearing in 73 games, including 26 starts, for Brooklyn last season, Whitehead has fallen out of the Nets rotation in 2017-18. He has not played since December 15th.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Brian Lewis on Twitter                            Jan 27 - 1:00 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Jimmy Butler
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Coach Tom Thibodeau said Jimmy Butler (knee) went through shootaround and is ""close,"" and that a decision will be made on Butler's status for Saturday's game vs. Brooklyn after pregame warmups.
        
        
             Butler has missed each of Minnesota's last four games, but appears to be on track to return for this contest. However, the Wolves tip off at 9:00 pm EST, which means we likely won't have a final update on Butler's status until after the 7:00 pm DFS main-slate roster lock. If Butler is cleared to play, Nemanja Bjelica will get bumped back to the bench.
        
        
             Related: Nemanja Bjelica
              
             Source: Jon Krawczynski on Twitter                        Jan 27 - 12:28 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Tomas Satoransky
                 
                 
                      - G -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tomas Satoransky will replace John Wall (knee) in the starting lineup Saturday vs. the Hawks.
        
        
             This will be the first start of the season for Satoransky, who has come off the bench in each of his previous 39 games. He has logged over 25 minutes in a game twice this season, and tallied at least 11 points and six assists in each of those contests. Satoransky will be worth consideration as a streamer or an affordable DFS punt on Saturday night. Tim Frazier will back up Satoransky and will see an uptick in minutes off the bench.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Candace Buckner on Twitter                        Jan 27 - 12:18 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"John Wall
                 
                 
                      - G -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            John Wall (sore left knee) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. Atlanta.
        
        
             Wall received platelet-rich plasma injections to reduce the inflammation in his left knee back in late November, which caused him to miss a total of nine games. He has started each of the 21 games the Wizards have played since. However, per coach Scott Brooks, Wall has dealt with left knee issues during this Wizards current road trip, and it became evident Thursday in OKC that ""something was wrong."" Brooks said Wall is day-to-day. Wall said he plans to travel to Cleveland next Monday to get a second opinion on the knee. Tomas Satoransky will start at PG on Saturday.
        
        
             Related: Tomas Satoransky, Tim Frazier
              
             Source: Candace Buckner on Twitter                        Jan 27 - 12:12 PM

            Damyean Dotson has been assigned to the Knicks' G-League affiliate.
        
        
             The Knicks don't play again until Tuesday, so Dotson will likely be called back up before Tuesday's game vs. Brooklyn.

"Tyler Johnson
                 
                 
                      - G -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tyler Johnson (ankle) went through shootaround, and Coach Erik Spoelstra said ""it's going in the right direction for [Johnson] to play"" Saturday vs. Charlotte.
        
        
             Johnson has missed five straight games but has made substantial progress and was initially listed as probable for Thursday's game vs. Sacramento, before being ruled out. We should have a final update/confirmation on Johnson's status when Coach Spo addresses the media at approximately 6:00 pm EST. Derrick Jones Jr. and Justise Winslow will likely see their minutes reduced with Johnson back in the lineup. Wayne Ellington and Josh Richardson have played well and logged heavy minutes in Johnson's absence as well.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Andre Fernandez on Twitter                        Jan 27 - 11:44 AM

"Michael Carter-Williams
                 
                 
                      - G -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Michael Carter-Williams (left shoulder strain) is listed as questionable for Saturday's game vs. Miami.
        
        
             Although he hasn't been all that productive, Carter-Williams has been surprisingly durable this season. He hasn't been sidelined since November, having played in 33 straight games for the Hornets. If MCW is unable to suit up on Saturday, Julyan Stone and Malik Monk would likely see an uptick in minutes.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Hornets PR on Twitter                             Jan 27 - 11:17 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Trey Burke
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Coach Jeff Hornacek said that he will need to ""find time"" for Trey Burke if Burke continues to play well.
        
        
             Burke has scored a total of 36 points in back-to-back games for New York. He's the first Knicks point guard to score at least 18 points in consecutive games off the bench since Nate Robinson in 2009. ""Its a game-to-game situation,"" Hornacek said of his point guards on Friday. ""They all lend something different."" Interestingly, Hornacek played Frank Ntilikina at shooting guard, alongside Burke, for a short stretch in Friday's win over Phoenix. He said it's something he would consider in the future as well.
        
        
             Related: Jarrett Jack, Frank Ntilikina
              
             Source: New York Post                                     Jan 27 - 11:15 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"T.J. Leaf
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            T.J. Leaf (right ankle) is listed as questionable for Saturday's game vs. the Magic.
        
        
             Leaf sat out Friday's game due to the ankle injury. We should have an update on his status for Saturday later this afternoon. Alex Poythress logged nine minutes off the bench on Friday. This is a situation to avoid from a fantasy perspective.
        
        
             
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Jan 27 - 11:12 AM

"Myles Turner
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Myles Turner (elbow) is listed as questionable on the injury report for Saturday's game vs. Orlando.
        
        
             Turner has missed each of the Pacers last nine games but appears to be inching closer to a return. He was able to practice fully with the team on Wednesday and Thursday. Domantas Sabonis has been starting in Turner's absence. If Turner can suit up on Saturday, he'll likely come off the bench behind Sabonis, as the Pacers will look to limit his minutes in his first few games back.
        
        
             Related: Domantas Sabonis
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Jan 27 - 11:10 AM

            Jon Leuer (ankle) underwent successful surgery on his left ankle on Friday.
        
        
             Leuer is facing four months of recovery and rehab, but is expected to be ready for training camp and the 2018-19 season.

"Tyson Chandler
                 
                 
                      - C -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Suns are not expected to shut down any of their veterans over the second half of the season, according to Suns reporter John Gambadoro.
        
        
             Gambadoro tweeted out earlier this week that, ""there is no scenario in which the Suns will sit down a player for the season this year. The goal is to try and win games."" Tyson Chandler didn't play in a single game following last year's All-Star break, but it appears that will not be the case in 2018.
        
        
             
              
             Source: John Gambadoro on Twitter                         Jan 27 - 10:36 AM

"Reggie Bullock
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Reggie Bullock (thumb) has been upgraded to probable for Saturday's game vs. OKC.
        
        
             Bullock was initially listed as questionable on the injury report released Friday. The upgrade to probable puts him on track to return to the lineup Saturday night. Assuming Bullock returns to the starting lineup on Saturday, Stanley Johnson would get bumped back to the bench. Johnson had seven points and five rebounds in 39 minutes as a starter on Wednesday.
        
        
             
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Jan 27 - 9:38 AM

                  In-season Projections"
"Rondae Hollis-Jefferson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Rondae Hollis-Jefferson's (groin) status for Saturday's game vs. Minnesota is uncertain, but coach Kenny Atkinson said he doesn't believe the injury will be a long-term issue.
        
        
             Hollis-Jefferson was forced out of Fridays game vs. Milwaukee due to a right groin strain and was unable to return to the contest. ""Well know more [Saturday], but hopefully nothing serious,"" said Atkinson after the game. When asked if Hollis-Jefferson was definitely ruled out of Saturdays game, Atkinson replied, ""I dont know. I think its a day-to-day thing.  Im an optimistic guy, and I know we need him."" Joe Harris and Quincy Acy would soak up additional minutes if RHJ is ruled out Saturday.
        
        
             Related: Quincy Acy, Joe Harris
              
             Source: New York Post                                     Jan 27 - 9:20 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
