                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Kristaps Porzingis
                 
                 
                      - F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kristaps Porzingis scored 19 points with seven rebounds, two assists, three blocks and three 3-pointers in a 107-85 win over the Suns on Friday.
        
        
             He's probably going to be a meme after he took a ball to his face during warmups (video in link below). Porzingis has also looked a lot better as a shooter lately after a really rough start to January. Before tonight, he only had a 40.7 FG% in January, but he's been above that mark in each of his last seven games. He leads qualifiers in blocks and he's sitting pretty at the line at 80.8 percent from the line, so he's a rare commodity in fantasy.
        
        
             
              
             Source: The Score                                         Jan 27 - 2:14 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Tim Hardaway Jr.
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tim Hardaway Jr. scored 15 points with seven rebounds, four assists, two steals, one block and one 3-pointer in 35 minutes against the Suns on Friday.
        
        
             He did have to go to the locker room after a hard foul from Devin Booker, but did return. He was just being tested for a concussion, and nothing really suggested he was concussed after his return. The NBA medical staffs have initially missed concussions recently for guys like Jamal Murray and Kris Dunn, so Hardaway Jr.'s fantasy owners may just want to make sure everything is good. He'll also start a back-to-back set on Tuesday, so don't be surprised to see him sit out that after missing time due to a leg stress fracture.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 27 - 2:07 AM

             He dominated the Suns and that makes it six straight good games for Kanter. He did get some favorable matchups recently, but of course this is great news after we saw him get benched earlier this season. Keep him rolling.

"Trey Burke
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Trey Burke scored 18 points with one rebound, three assists and two 3-pointers in just 18 minutes against the Suns on Friday.
        
        
             Make it back-to-back games with 18 points with Burke also going 3-of-3 for strong games during his outings in the MST time zone. The Knicks are probably going to turn it over to Frank Ntilikina at some point, but he's not really giving them any reason to as Burke plays well in almost all of his chances. He's not a must-grab player in fantasy, but he has to be worth a look in leagues where point guards don't last on the waiver wire. Don't be surprised if he unseats Jarrett Jack to possibly boost his value, too.

Warren is dropping 20 is becoming old hat with him hitting that mark in five of his last six active games. Daniels is worth a look if you need 3-pointers, but Darius Miller may be the hotter add tonight.

"Josh Jackson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Josh Jackson scored 18 points with eight rebounds, two steals and one 3-pointer in 29 minutes against the Knicks on Friday.
        
        
             He's playing his best ball of the season and it starts with shot selection. In his last four games, 51.1 percent of his shot total has come in the paint with him making 15-of-22 in that range. Stats wise, he's averaged 15.0 points, 3.0 boards, 0.5 steals and 1.3 treys in those four. It will be a bumpy ride, but Jackson is starting to gain some appeal as a stash thanks to his position flexibility.

"Marquese Chriss
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marquese Chriss returned from a five-game absence against the Knicks on Friday, making 1-of-12 from the field for three points with four rebounds, one assist, one block, one steal and one 3-pointer in 20 minutes.
        
        
             The rust was there on both ends, but at least he only had three fouls. It took like two months for Chriss to finally get going this season, so hopefully it's not a repeat there. Dragan Bender has lost all of his momentum, Alex Len is banged up, and the Suns will really want to see if Chriss can be a center in some matchups, so Chriss' opportunity is as high as any young big man. He should be owned in standard leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 27 - 1:28 AM

"Dennis Smith Jr.
                 
                 
                      - G -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dennis Smith Jr. scored 18 points vs. the Blazers on Friday in 33 minutes.
        
        
             After averaging 26.8 minutes in December, DSJ has now played 30+ minutes in eight straight games. He finished 7-of-14 from the field without any free throws, adding seven assists, four rebounds, two steals and four triples. After a rocky start to the season, DSJ looks like he could be a fantasy stud down the stretch.

Monroe is basically the last man standing and could see big minutes against the Rockets on Sunday. He's worth a look with no other healthy centers on the Suns as of Friday night.

He did play some center, but he looked bad in that role, too.

He's been all over the place lately, but he hasn't played less than 30 minutes in a game since Dec. 2 and is one of a few players that fantasy owners can rely on in Dallas. He gets a matchup with the Nuggets on Sunday.

                  In-season Projections"
"Pau Gasol
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Pau Gasol ended up with 11 points in Friday's 97-78 home loss against Philadelphia.
        
        
             Gasol hit 3-of-9 from the field while finishing with a game-worst minus-18 rating over 18 minutes. With the game out of hand for most of the evening, Gasol was rested for large chunks of the second half, giving his still healing wrist extra rest. Joffrey Lauvergne saw a bigger role off the bench, and he had the hot hand in his action. Despite the poor outing, Gasol remains a top-100 fantasy option across the board.

"Lou Williams
                 
                 
                      - G -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Lou Williams went berserk during a 109-100 win over the Grizzlies on Friday, scoring 40 points with two rebounds, 10 assists, four 3-pointers, four steals and one block in 34 minutes.
        
        
             His first half was ridiculous with 22 points in the first 15 minutes of action -- he was 9-of-10 from the line in that time and finished 12-of-14. Williams becomes the first player since 1982 to put up a 40-point, 10-dime game off the bench (Brian Winters). Williams has been one of the best steals in fantasy and the Clippers playing well is huge for his value.

"DeMarcus Cousins
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            An MRI on DeMarcus Cousins revealed a full rupture of his left Achilles tendon, according to Shams Charania of Yahoo! Sports.
        
        
             This will end his season and make him questionable to start the 2018-19 season. According to this report, he will have surgery as soon as possible, and then begin a difficult rehab. ESPN also reports that his recovery time ranges from 6-10 months. Plus, his size will make it even tougher with guys like Elton Brand never really looking the same after an Achilles tear.

He'll look to a bounce-back game Sunday afternoon against Phoenix, the worst team defense in the NBA. Still, a 10-rebound performance isn't anything to sneeze at.

At this point you just have to hope for a turnaround, as he can be helpful as a forward in the 3-pointer category when running hot.

"Zach LaVine
                 
                 
                      - G -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Zach LaVine hit 3-of-17 shots for 10 points, three rebounds, one assist and two triples in a 108-103 loss to the Lakers on Friday.
        
        
             Coach Fred Hoiberg questioned his shot selection tonight and said he ""settled"" for some long mid-range 2s. ""I felt good. I just missed a lot of easy shots,"" LaVine said. ""I have to be better. Tonight, I sucked. Its a process. It gets frustrating at times. You want to smooth it out."" The good news is that he played a season-high 26 minutes, and coach Fred Hoiberg is confident he'll get better when he becomes more comfortable with his teammates. He averaged 20.0 points, 6.0 rebounds, 2.5 assists and 2.0 triples in his previous two games, so this was just an off night and LaVine's owners shouldn't be concerned.

"Donovan Mitchell
                 
                 
                      - G -  Jazz

On the last important offensive possession, Mitchell also had a smart pass out of a double-team to get Ricky Rubio a wide-open, game-winning triple. Mitchell is special in more ways than one and looks like he'll be an early-round fantasy contributor for over a decade.

"DeMarcus Cousins
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            DeMarcus Cousins has suffered a torn left Achilles tendon and he will miss the rest of the season, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.com.
        
        
             Ugh. There is still no official word on the MRI, but Woj adds the diagnosis is ""clear"" that it's a tear. This is a franchise-changing injury for the Pelicans and it'll be interesting to see if they are more willing to trade Anthony Davis. Cousins will also be considered doubtful to start his 2018-19 season, and this could affect his free agent market as an unrestricted free agent at age 27. In the fantasy world, his fantasy owners just got a death blow and can drop him in redraft formats. Darius Miller looks like the best pickup because Dante Cunningham doesn't offer much fantasy upside, and maybe the Pelicans look to sign someone. Perhaps they even trade for someone like Greg Monroe. Get well soon, Boogie.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Adrian Wojnarowski on Twitter                     Jan 26 - 11:26 PM

He isn't a great fantasy contributor in roto leagues due to his lack of defensive stats, but those in standard formats aren't complaining about his production too vehemently.

"Giannis Antetokounmpo
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Giannis Antetokounmpo (knee) confirmed that he has been cleared to play Friday night vs. Brooklyn.
        
        
             The Bucks sat out Antetokounmpo in each of each Milwaukee's previous two games in order to ""manage soreness"" in his right knee. The plan all along was for him to return for Friday's game vs. the Nets. Fortunately, it appears that Antetokounmpo hasn't suffered any setbacks and was able to practice this week. Make sure he is locked and loaded in all fantasy lineups this evening.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Stephen Watson on Twitter                         Jan 26 - 12:13 PM

                  In-season Projections"
"Kevin Durant
                 
                 
                      - F -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kevin Durant dropped his second triple-double of the season during a 126-113 win over the Wolves on Thursday, scoring 28 points with 10 rebounds, 11 assists, three blocks, two steals and six 3-pointers in 37 minutes.
        
        
             It's the first time in his NBA career that he had double-digit dimes in consecutive games after his career-high 14 helpers on Tuesday. Durant has also been ridiculous as a shooter since he returned from injury eight games ago, averaging 26.3 points, 6.3 boards, 7.5 dimes, 1.4 steals, 1.3 blocks and 3.4 treys on a 69.7 TS% and a 27.6 usage rate. That includes a 64.5 eFG% on his 100 jumpers in that span while he's only been blocked twice on his 133 attempts overall in this stretch, as well. LeBron James made him the first pick in the All-Star Team draft and it's easy to see why.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 26 - 1:32 AM

                Career Stats

             Those seven treys match his season-high as he bounced back from scoring just 17 points combined in his previous two. Thompson made the All-Star Team again and Stephen Curry added him to his team as a reserve. He's been quietly consistent as a third-round value in standard leagues this season.

            Bradley Beal matched his career-high 12 boards against the Thunder during a 121-112 loss on Thursday, adding 41 points, seven assists, two steals and six 3-pointers in 46 minutes.
        
        
             He was going heads up against Russell Westbrook in the fourth with Beal dropping 18 points in the final quarter, including four 3-pointers with four boards, three dimes and two turnovers in those 12 minutes. Beal has been on an tear over his last dozen games, average 27.3 points, 4.9 boards, 4.9 assists, 1.3 steals and 3.2 treys on a 63.4 TS% and a 27.2 usage rate. He looks a lot like the 2017 post-break version of himself and his owners should be expecting him to flirt with first-round value going forward.
        
        
             
              
             Jan 25 - 10:54 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats

"John Wall
                 
                 
                      - G -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            John Wall made 7-of-16 from the field for 21 points with one rebound, 12 assists, one block, two steals and five 3-pointers in 35 minutes against the Thunder on Thursday.
        
        
             Garbage time helped him out here with three 3-pointers in the final 2:02 of this loss. If not for those nine points, it could've been four consecutive games when Wall didn't score more than 16 points. Wall is prone to slumps and it looks like he doesn't have a chance to match his career-high 45.1 percent from the field from last season -- he's at 41.7 percent on this season. He's still a near lock for early-round value with his stat-stuffing ways.

"JaMychal Green
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            JaMychal Green (right ankle) will not play vs. the Clippers on Friday.
        
        
             We haven't heard about Green practicing in any capacity, so this is no surprise. He's missed three straight games and we'll consider him questionable to return vs. the Suns on Monday. Jarell Martin (knee, ankle) isn't a lock to play on Friday, so guys like Myke Henry and Ivan Rabb could be forced into solid minutes.

                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Kyrie Irving
                 
                 
                      - G -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kyrie Irving reportedly might need ""minor [left] knee surgery"" during the offseason.
        
        
             To be very clear, this isn't an imminent concern. It only came up because of a report that Irving threatened to have surgery and sit out the 2017-18 season if the Cavs didn't trade him this summer. According to Cavs writer Joe Vardon, ""Irving needs minor knee surgery as a follow to the procedure he underwent during the 2015 Finals to repair his broken knee cap. It's not pressing ... but the procedure would ease some of the swelling and day-to-day pain he feels."" Irving did bang his left knee during Tuesday's game, but dismissed it as ""a little sore,"" and there's no reason to think he'll miss games.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Cleveland.com                                     Jan 25 - 3:30 PM

"Jamal Murray
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jamal Murray said he's growing more comfortable as a point guard in the NBA, and is learning how to ""distribute and make sure everybody is happy.""
        
        
             ""I can be happy scoring the ball,"" Murray said. ""But when everybody isnt touching the ball, and were not making the defense move, its kind of pointless."" He's been on fire over the past two games with 34.0 points on 66.7% shooting, 5.0 rebounds, 4.0 assists and 1.0 blocks, with a mere 1.0 turnovers. Fantasy owners can echo coach Mike Malone's sentiment: ""You ask yourself, whats this kids ceiling? Who knows?""
        
        
             
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Jan 25 - 3:16 PM

"Tristan Thompson
                 
                 
                      - C -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tristan Thompson will replace Jae Crowder in the starting lineup going forward according to coach Tyronn Lue.
        
        
             Lue has been contemplating a lineup change for a while now and has finally pulled the trigger. With Thompson at the five, this will push Kevin Love back to his natural position at the four. The Cavaliers have lost six of their last seven games, but we'll see if this move pays dividends starting on Friday vs. the Pacers. Thompson is hitting 60.9% from the line this season, but he should get a bump in minutes with this lineup change and will be a nice source of rebounds.
        
        
             Related: Jae Crowder

             Skal Labissiere is also available, but you'd think he's less likely to be moved. The Kings are in advanced talks with the Cavaliers to acquire Channing Frye, Iman Shumpert and draft compensation for George Hill, but they would need to clear a roster spot first. The 22-year-old Richardson has played just 12.8 minutes in 24 appearances this season, but it's hard to imagine him becoming relevant in fantasy if he's moved.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Sacramento Bee                                    Jan 25 - 11:29 AM

Now, whenever I can, Ill play him. I wont hesitate to play him. If somebodys hurt or sick, hell play. Or if I can find time, I will.""              Coach Tom Thibodeau has ditched some of his two-center lineups lately, which has caused Dieng's minutes to take a dip. Over his last five, he's averaged just 4.8 points, 3.0 boards, 1.2 blocks and 0.8 steals in 16.6 minutes per game. His upside is severely capped if he can't get to 20 minutes per game.

"John Collins
                 
                 
                      - F -  Hawks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            John Collins hauled in a career-high 16 rebounds on Wednesday, adding 13 points (5-of-13 FGs, 3-of-4 FTs) and a career-high-tying four blocks in 26 minutes.
        
        
             Collins is averaging 2.8 offensive rebounds per game, 11th best in the league, and he's 8th in OREB rate (14.2%). He's a handful for opposing teams, in other words, and all those possessions at the rim have helped him average 10.6 points on stellar 59.0% shooting this season. With the Hawks building for the future, Collins is a prime breakout candidate in the second half of the season.

                      - F -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Pascal Siakam had six points, four rebounds, one assist, one steal and one block vs. Atlanta, going 3-of-5 from the field and 0-of-2 from the line in 20 minutes.
        
        
             Toronto's long-term aspirations for Siakam are intriguing. ""We want [Siakam and OG Anunoby] ... to handle the ball in transition, to bring the ball down, to be that point-four, point-three, bringing it down to trigger the offense,"" said coach Dwane Casey. For now, they'll settle for solid defense, rebounding and hustle in transition. Siakam also needs to improve his shooting range, since he's just 16.1% from deep this season. He's on the radar in deeper leagues, but most owners can ignore him.

"Ben Simmons
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Ben Simmons triple-doubled on Wednesday with 19 points, 17 rebounds, 14 assists and two blocks in 39 minutes vs. Chicago, going 6-of-15 from the field and 7-of-10 from the line.
        
        
             Simmons hauled in 11 boards in the first quarter alone, which were the most for a Philly player in any quarter since Samuel Dalembert in 2010. He got his triple-double faster than any rookie has done it in 20 years, and he's also the first player with multiple trip-dubs vs. the Bulls in a single season since Darrell Walker in 1989-90. We're going to hear plenty more historic parallels for Simmons in the coming years -- if you own him in a dynasty points league, start engraving the trophy now.

"Kemba Walker
                 
                 
                      - G -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            With trade rumors swirling around him, Kemba Walker had 20 points, seven assists, five rebounds, three 3-pointers and six turnovers in 34 minutes on Wednesday.

Walker is the main target for teams inquiring about Charlotte's players, of course, and Charlotte may be more willing to trade him if they can't string together some victories -- they're now 19-27 on the season, 5.0 games behind Philly for the No. 8 seed. Fantasy owners should be hoping he stays put in Charlotte.

Cleveland will practice on Thursday, so perhaps we'll get a hint of the changes that are coming at that point.

"Courtney Lee
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Courtney Lee is unconcerned regarding recent trade rumors that have involved him, saying, ""if I get traded, I get traded. If I'm here, I'm here. I'm happy either way.""
        
        
             ""Ive been in this league 10 years, been traded a couple times. Its nothing new,"" said Lee of hearing his name in the rumor mill. ""Only thing you can do is control what you can control, show up, be professional, do your work, go hard and leave it all out on the floor and whatever happens happens."" Lee is having a career-year as a starter in New York, but his value would likely take a significant hit if he was shipped off to a contender. Owners may want to consider selling high here.

                      - F -  Pacers

             Robinson told reporters earlier this month that he was hoping to return before the All-Star break, but McMillan said on Tuesday that there was only a ""small chance"" that happens. GRIII will be eased back into action once he is cleared to play, and will likely be on a minutes restriction. He should be left on waivers in all standard leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Scott Agness on Twitter                           Jan 23 - 1:18 PM

"Willy Hernangomez
                 
                 
                      - C -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Opposing executives believe that the Knicks will move one of their four centers before the deadline, according to Ian Begley of ESPN.
        
        
             Joakim Noah is essentially untradeable due to his burdensome contract. However, both Willy Hernangomez and Kyle O'Quinn have team-friendly deals. Hernangomez has not been a consistent part of the Knicks rotation this season after making the All-NBA Rookie Team in 2016-17. Teams are eager to poach him in they feel the Knicks are undervaluing him. Any trade would boost Willy's fantasy value, as he would see an increase in playing time elsewhere.

"Wilson Chandler
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Wilson Chandler moved to the bench on Monday vs. the Blazers, scoring six points with five rebounds, one assist, two steals and three blocks in 31 minutes.
        
        
             This was one of his most active games on the defensive end this season, and while Chandler has been vocal in the past about not wanting to come off the bench, this was probably a temporary move -- the Nuggets may have started Will Barton so he could have some revenge on his former team. Chandler hasn't scored more than six points in five straight games, so he's not a standard-league asset.

"Darius Miller
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Darius Miller came off the bench and hit 3-of-10 shots (all 3-pointers) for 10 points, eight rebounds, two assists and a steal in 41 minutes of Monday's overtime win against the Bulls.
        
        
             This was his first 40-minute game of the season, while starter Rajon Rondo played just 15 minutes tonight. Miller has actually been playing well lately, averaging 13 points, 5.7 rebounds, 1.0 steals and 2.7 3-pointers over his last three, playing 34 minutes in them. If you're in a deep league and need 3-pointers, he's worth a look.

"Anthony Davis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Anthony Davis hit 14-of-23 shots and 6-of-8 free throws on his way to 34 points, nine rebounds, five assists, two steals and a block before fouling out in 43 minutes of Monday's 132-128 overtime win against the Bulls.
        
        
             Davis' minutes have been out of control, as he's played at least 38 of them in six straight games, so maybe the foul out was a unintentional gift. He looked great again tonight and the heavy minutes have yet to take a toll on the big man, but we're hoping the Pelicans can start keeping him at least under 40 per game soon. He's too injury prone to play such heavy minutes for much longer, at least as far as his fantasy owners should be concerned.

             Jan 22 - 11:35 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"DeMarcus Cousins
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            DeMarcus Cousins went off for 44 points, 24 rebounds, 10 assists, four steals, a block and five 3-pointers on 13-of-29 shooting in 52 minutes of Monday's 132-128 overtime win against the Bulls.
        
        
             Boogie Nights! Cousins became the first player since Wilt Chamberlain in 1968 to post a 40-20-10 game and he even managed to avoid fouling out, despite all the minutes. The points and boards were both season highs and this was his second triple-double of the season, as he had 29 points, 12 boards and 10 assists back on Oct. 28. Cousins came in as the No. 10 fantasy player in nine-cat leagues and he's probably going to jump a few spots after this historic performance.

"Jerian Grant
                 
                 
                      - G -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jerian Grant hit 6-of-7 shots, 2-of-2 3-pointers and 8-of-8 free throws on his way to 22 points, five rebounds, a career-high 13 assists, two steals, a block and six turnovers in 47 minutes of Monday's 132-128 overtime loss to the Pelicans.
        
        
             Kris Dunn is out with a concussion and Grant went nuts tonight. Believe it or not, the 22 points were not a season high, but it was close. Dunn's very iffy for the rest of the week and after tonight, Grant can be deployed in DFS or even season-long leagues for as long as Dunn is out. Just keep in mind that he'd really been struggling to score, putting up no more than eight points in all but one of his January games.

He had nine points alone in the fourth quarter and helped the Grizzlies come back from a 15-point deficit. Henry is getting an opportunity while JaMychal Green (ankle) is out, but unless he does this again, Jarell Martin will continue to be the better short-term asset.

"Malcolm Brogdon

            Malcolm Brogdon hit 11-of-14 shots, 3-of-4 3-pointers and 7-of-8 free throws for a career-high 32 points, four rebounds, two assists, three steals and a block in 35 minutes of Monday's win over the Suns.
        
        
             Wow. He was on fire tonight and has been playing extremely well in January after a slow start to the season. He missed Saturday's game for personal reasons, but was back in full force and effect tonight. Jason Kidd is out for the Bucks and Brogdon had the best game of his career in his first game without him. Hopefully this is a sign of things to come from Brogdon the rest of the way, although it won't be easy for him to match it once Giannis Antetokounmpo is back from his knee injury.

"Robert Covington
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Robert Covington scored 18 points with six rebounds, three assists, one block and four triples in 34 minutes vs. the Grizzlies on Monday.
        
        
             He filled up the boxscore, but didn't do it efficiently, hitting 5-of-14 shots and 4-of-5 free throws with three turnovers. He also made a terrible decision down the stretch, as he jacked up a wild 3-pointer with nine seconds left even though Philly was down by two points at the time. He was shooting 38.6% from the field in January prior to tonight and his shot hasn't looked the same since the first couple months of the season, but he'll continue to log heavy minutes for Philly because of his defense. Once his shot starts falling, he'll be an elite fantasy asset again.

"Jeremy Lamb
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Hornets

             He's cooled off a tad, averaging 12.3 points, 4.6 boards, 1.5 assists, 0.9 steals and 1.3 treys and 0.4 blocks in his previous games this month, but his value gets a boost with the Kemba Walker trade rumors. Lamb should probably be owned everywhere with his mid-round upside in case Kemba or others are dealt.

Milwaukee management reportedly decided to make the move after the Bucks fell to the No. 8 seed out East, and there had been discontent brewing between both parties for a couple years now. Kidd's constantly changing rotations were a nightmare, so perhaps his departure will bring some stability.

"Kawhi Leonard
                 
                 
                      - F -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            According to Adrian Wojnarowski and Michael C. Wright of ESPN, Kawhi Leonard and his camp have been described as ""distant"" and ""disconnected"" from the Spurs.
        
        
             According to the report, ""Months of discord centering on elements of treatment, rehabilitation and timetables for return from a right quadriceps injury have had a chilling impact"" on Leonard's relationship with the front office and coaching staff. Wojnarowski adds that ""there is work to be done to repair what has been until now a successful partnership,"" so the Spurs find themselves in rare territory for a franchise that is considered to be one of the best in all of sports. Spurs GM RC Buford has refuted these claims, but did add that this process has been ""difficult for everyone."" The superstar forward remains without a timetable to return as he continues to rehab his troublesome quad injury.

             ""[Gregg Popovich] told me ... that he thought it was time,"" Parker said. ""And I was like, 'No, problem.'"" "Danilo Gallinari
                 
                 
                      - F -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Danilo Gallinari (glute) reportedly ""hopes to return in the next couple weeks.""
        
        
             There haven't been many concrete updates and we'll take what we can get. The oft-injured veteran is dealing with a partially torn left glute -- he was expected to miss about six weeks as of Dec. 21, so this fits his initial timetable. Given the uncertainty of his situation, most owners should probably wait until we've seen him practice before stashing him.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Denver Post                                       Jan 21 - 10:42 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Dejounte Murray
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dejounte Murray was a surprise starter vs. the Pacers on Sunday, and Tony Parker suggested afterward that it's a permanent change.
        
        
             Murray finished with eight points, seven rebounds, four assists, three steals and one block in 28 minutes, but the biggest news came after the game. Parker told reporters that Gregg Popovich ""thought it was time"" he yield the starting job, and Parker didn't object. Murray started 14 games prior to Sunday, averaging 8.9 points, 7.1 rebounds, 3.6 assists, 1.1 steals, 0.3 blocks and 2.4 turnovers. He's not a 3-point shooter and struggles with percentages, and the starting gig isn't a guarantee of big minutes in San Antonio, but he's a decent pickup while we see how he fares.
        
        
             Related: Tony Parker, Patty Mills
              
             Jan 21 - 10:18 PM

"LaMarcus Aldridge
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            LaMarcus Aldridge had a poor double-double during Sunday's home loss, going 5-of-14 from the field for 10 points, 10 rebounds, one assist and one block.
        
        
             Aldridge didn't get to the free-throw line and he committed four turnovers. He's a combined 11-of-39 from the field in the Spurs' past two games, but fantasy owners have to be thrilled with the usage and playing time -- he's logged at least 35 minutes in four consecutive games. Gregg Popovich even praised him after the game, saying, ""He hasnt shot it well, but his effort has been off the charts."" He'll resume making shots soon enough.

"Tony Parker
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tony Parker came off the bench on Sunday for 12 points (5-of-10 FGs, 1-of-2 FTs), five assists, three rebounds, one steal and one 3-pointer in 20 minutes.
        
        
             This was the 21st time Parker has come off the bench in his career, and the first time since the 2010 postseason. Dejounte Murray took his spot and Gregg Popovich would only say ""we'll see"" when asked if the move would last longer than one game. The Spurs may have simply wanted more playmaking into the second unit with Manu Ginobili (thigh) and Rudy Gay (heel) out again, but we'll find out when they face the Cavs on Tuesday. Either way, this doesn't change Parker's fantasy value very much since the key is him staying on the court and avoiding DNP-CDs.

"Aaron Gordon

            Aaron Gordon's shooting woes continued on Sunday as he went just 5-of-17 from the field and 1-of-2 from the stripe on his way to 11 points, 13 boards, four assists and two turnovers in 38 minutes.
        
        
             Gordon has been connecting on just 33.6% of his shot attempts over the past eight games, although hes still been effective with averages of 16.5 points, 8.5 boards, 2.3 assists, 1.3 triples, 0.8 steals and 2.4 turnovers per game. We should see a regression to the mean with his jump shot soon enough, and the steals numbers should also start trending up as well. A favorable matchup against the Kings on Tuesday could help him to start moving in the right direction.

""Kevins been great all year and we got to continue to get him touches and continue to feature him, no matter whos on the floor."" His usage rate drops from 26.6 to 20.2 with Isaiah Thomas on the floor, so his value is trending in the wrong direction. The Blazers are right in the thick of the playoff race and Dame's owners can expect him to suit up for every game he can as a top-10 player in standard leagues.

"Stephen Curry
                 
                 
                      - G -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stephen Curry made just 6-of-20 from the field for 19 points during a 116-108 loss to the Rockets on Saturday, adding one rebound, eight assists, two steals, six turnovers and five 3-pointers in 36 minutes.
        
        
             When the Warriors lose, it's usually because of turnovers. That and not rebounding the ball well was their undoing today, and the Warriors usually find themselves losing in net possessions because of those two aforementioned issues. Curry also had his worst FG% today since Nov. 16 in Boston and he only made 2-of-4 from the line. He's human after all, apparently.

"T.J. McConnell
                 
                 
                      - G -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            T.J. McConnell finished with 11 points, seven assists, three rebounds and two assists across 32 minutes off the bench in Saturday's 116-94 win against the Bucks.
        
        
             McConnell hit 5-of-10 from the field, taking advantage of a slight bump in playing time with Jerryd Bayless (wrist) and J.J. Redick (leg) on the shelf. He is enjoying a season-best four-game streak with double-digit point totals, averaging 14.0 points, 5.5 assists, 3.8 rebounds and 2.8 steals per game during the four-game span. He is a nice short-term pick-up if you need help at the point guard position, but know his value will dry up once Redick is back in two weeks.

             Beal also connected on 4-of-7 from behind the 3-point line, while adding 8-of-9 from the free-throw stripe. Head coach Scott Brooks admonished his team after a subpar effort last time out, warning of minutes decreases for players not giving maximum effort. Beal didn't see his time curtailed, and he has been on fire lately and wasn't likely one of the players Brooks was trying to get through to.

                  In-season Projections"
"Patty Mills
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Patty Mills scored 13 points vs. the Raptors on Friday, but hit just 4-of-14 shots.
        
        
             Tony Parker couldn't get anything going offensively, so we saw a lot of Mills and Dejounte Murray tonight. Mills played 28 minutes in the loss, adding four rebounds, one assist and one triple.  Kawhi Leonard (quad) is out indefinitely, Rudy Gay (heel) is a couple weeks away and Manu Ginobili (bruised thigh) is day-to-day, so Mills will continue to benefit in their absence. He's still just a low-end option if you need triples and a handful of dimes.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Dejounte Murray
                 
                 
                      - G -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dejounte Murray scored 10 points with seven rebounds, one assist and three turnovers in 26 minutes vs. the Raptors on Friday.
        
        
             Tony Parker finished 1-of-9 from the field in 17 minutes, so the Spurs rolled with Murray and Patty Mills for most of the night. We're seeing a lot more two-PG lineups lately because the Spurs are so banged up, so Murray is trending up. He's averaging 7.8 points, 7.0 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 1.4 steals in 20.8 minutes per game over his last five, and while he's not a great option in re-draft formats at the moment, his dynasty owners have to be pleased with his recent progress. Whenever Parker rests, Murray will get a bump.

            LaMarcus Aldridge scored 17 points in Friday's 86-83 loss to the Raptors, hitting just 6-of-25 shots and 4-of-5 free throws.
        
        
             The Raptors switched Jonas Valanciunas onto LMA early into the game and the move paid dividends for Toronto. Pau Gasol said that Aldridge is going to be the ""focal point"" of the offense going forward with Kawhi Leonard (quad) out indefinitely, but we'll chalk this up as a rare off night for the big man. The good news is that he salvaged his fantasy line in other categories, racking up 14 rebounds with two assists, one steal, two blocks and one triple in 37 minutes.

If he's out, that means Josh Hart will be very busy while Corey Brewer, Tyler Ennis and maybe even Gary Payton II pick up some decent run.

"Jordan Bell
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Coach Steve Kerr said that the X-ray on Jordan Bell's ankle came back clean that Bell is likely dealing with a bone bruise.
        
        
             All things considered, this certainly qualifies as encouraging news. ""The MRI was pretty good this morning  nothing glaring,"" Kerr said in a radio interview on Thursday. ""The X-ray was fine yesterday. So, it doesnt appear to be more than a bone bruise, but bone bruises can be tricky to heal. So, well see what happens, but so far the news has all been good."" The Warriors are expected to formally announce the results of the MRI on Friday. We'll provide an update at that time.

"Damian Lillard
                 
                 
                      - G -  Trail Blazers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Damian Lillard scored a game-high 26 points during a 100-86 win over the Pacers on Thursday, adding five rebounds, eight assists, one block and two 3-pointers in 40 minutes.
        
        
             It's safe to say he's back as he's driving more and getting to the line more frequently, too. Since his return on Jan. 10, Lillard averaged 26.0 points, 4.6 boards, 7.8 assists, 1.4 steals and 2.2 treys on 47.8 percent from the field and 88.6 percent from the line -- 7.0 attempts per game from the charity stripe, too. His fantasy owners can probably expect him to flirt with top-10 value the rest of the way, especially with the Blazers in the thick of the playoff race.

We're expecting him to flirt with first-round value the rest of the way.

"Isaiah Thomas
                 
                 
                      - G -  Lakers

McConnell was very efficient in this game with his 5-of-8 shooting line, so he probably won't be getting into the teens too often. The 76ers play every other day until their back-to-back starts on Jan. 28, so McConnell is worth a look if you need a boost at PG for the next 11 days while Redick is on the shelf.

"Harry Giles
                 
                 
                      - F -  Kings
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Harry Giles (knee) has been ruled out for the 2017-18 season.
        
        
             Giles is reportedly ""healthy"" and hasn't suffered any setbacks, but the Kings will hold him out until the Summer League. Giles tore his left ACL in 2013 and his right one in 2015, and the Kings want to improve his overall strength before throwing him into game action. The Kings are saying that his measurements in athletic tests are better than they were before the draft, and he still has some intrigue in dynasty formats.

""Trying to figure out different ways to get us on the court together and have [Shabazz] out there."" "Lou Williams
                 
                 
                      - G -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Nuggets kept Lou Williams in check on Wednesday, but he still finished with 17 points, five assists, four rebounds, two 3-pointers and one steal in 36 minutes.
        
        
             Williams encountered waves of defenders and a lot of Gary Harris tonight, which limited him to 6-of-18 shooting and a modest four free-throw attempts. This is the first time in nearly a month that he's been held under 20 points, ending an incredible 13-game stretch during which he averaged 31.2 points and 4.4 triples while shooting 47.9% from the field and 91.9% from the line. He's shattered all expectations in his 13th NBA season, and it's hard to 'sell high' on him unless you're getting back a definite top-50 value.

             The jumper was not falling tonight and the Nuggets first unit wasn't able to get it going in the second half. Jokic's numbers have been considerably worse when he's next to Mason Plumlee over his last 11 games with better efficiency, a higher usage rate, better rebounding numbers and better assist percentages all when Plumlee is on the bench. Jokic will be fine regardless, but his owners should be rooting for Plumlee to move to the bench.

"Mason Plumlee
                 
                 
                      - C -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Mason Plumlee scored 16 points with 14 rebounds, two assists and three steals in 31 minutes during a start against the Clippers on Wednesday.
        
        
             It was a big game after a very quiet five-point, 14-minute Tuesday. Coach Mike Malone ditched his double-center lineup on Tuesday, but he went back to it tonight. The lineups with Nikola Jokic and Plumlee only have a -10.6 net rating in the last 11 games, so it hasn't been an effective combo. Plumlee's long-term really isn't there anyway, so most fantasy owners should look for another waiver target.

"George Hill
                 
                 
                      - G -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            George Hill filled up the stat sheet on Wednesday with 20 points, five assists, four rebounds, four 3-pointers, three steals and zero turnovers in 37 minutes.
        
        
             He made 6-of-10 FGs and 4-of-5 FTs tonight, marking perhaps his most complete fantasy outing with the Kings. This was Hill's fourth game all season with 20+ points and the minutes were just shy of his season-high, but there's no real cause for excitement. Sacramento is starting to rest veterans and Hill is an obvious candidate for DNP-CDs -- at age 31 he's the fourth-oldest player on the team. Enjoy the production while you can.

             He played 39 minutes and you should double-check that he's not available in your leagues. The Kings will rest 2-3 veterans every game and Bogdanovic is one of the big winners here, as the 25-year-old is more polished than most rookies thanks to years of pro experience overseas. The league's GMs ranked him one of the summer's ""most underrated player acquisitions"" before the season began, and we're starting to see why.

             WCS played 37 minutes tonight and he's now averaging 36.7 minutes in the Kings' past three games. His fantasy owners have to be thrilled that Sacramento is turning him loose in mid-January, rather than waiting until the All-Star break. With multiple veterans resting every night, Cauley-Stein's rest-of-season outlook is fantastic.

             The 21-year-old held his own in his first start in the NBA, which is encouraging for a Grizzlies team that might commit to rebuilding sooner rather than later. Gasol is day-to-day so Davis is only on the radar as a potential streaming option vs. the Kings on Friday.

He's been worth owning since Reggie Jackson (ankle) went down, so owners should shrug it off. If you're looking for solace, consider that Chris Bosh once shot 1-of-18 in a game for the Heat.

            Dejounte Murray scored three points with nine rebounds, three assists, two steals and two turnovers in 23 minutes against the Nets on Wednesday.
        
        
             The Spurs are really thin on the wing, so Murray should be looking at some minutes at the two. He has the length to earn more run there and he's a terrific rebounder for his position. Still, he may need Tony Parker or Patty Mills to miss time to break through in standard leagues.

"Spencer Dinwiddie
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nets

             With no turnovers as well, that makes this game the most assists for a Net without a turnover since Jason Kidd's 13 way back in 2004. Dinwiddie has been superb at the point and he's clearly earned minutes even when D'Angelo Russell returns, which could come on Friday. His per-minute numbers are fantastic with DAR, so Dinwiddie should still be held in all leagues.

"Dwight Howard
                 
                 
                      - C -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dwight Howard had another terrific game on Wednesday with 18 points, 15 rebounds, two assists, two steals and two blocks in 29 minutes.

Dwight was a model of efficiency, too, making 7-of-13 FGs and 4-of-5 FTs tonight. Fantasy owners who gambled on the 32-year-old have been richly rewarded this season.

"Jamal Murray
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jamal Murray (concussion protocol) will not play against the Clippers on Wednesday.
        
        
             The injury happened on Tuesday night and Murray was diagnosed with a facial contusion. He did return to the game in the fourth, but the team monitored him through the night and Wednesday morning. Murray does not have a timetable to return, but hopefully this is more of a day-to-day issue. With him out, that should mean Emmanuel Mudiay gets in the rotation again while Will Barton plays more PG. That should also open up minutes for Torrey Craig and Malik Beasley.RotoGrinders.com Daily Slant: Believe it or not, with Millsap/Murray and non-active Nuggets off the floor, Emmanuel Mudiay actually leads the team in usage at 25.9% (0.85 FPPM). While the majority of that production came with the second-unit against back-ups, Mudiay does enter the DFS discussion but remains a low-floor/high-ceiling option. Will Barton is the safer target with a higher ceiling, as he figures to pick up ball-handling duties.

"Devin Booker
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Devin Booker went off for 43 points in Tuesday's 118-111 loss to the Blazers.
        
        
             That's the third game of his career with 40+ points. He did everything he could to give the Suns a chance with 21 points in the fourth quarter, but it wasn't enough as they dropped their third straight game. He finished 14-of-29 from the field and hit all 10 of his free throws with eight assists, six rebounds, two steals, one block and five triples, becoming the first Phoenix Sun to record 43+ points and 8+ assists since Stephon Marbury in 2003. He's quickly becoming one of the top shooting guards in the NBA.

"Nikola Jokic
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nikola Jokic dominated in a 105-102 win over the Mavericks on Tuesday, scoring 29 points with a season-high 18 rebounds, seven assists, one block and two steals in 33 minutes.
        
        
             The matchup was obviously favorable, but the big takeaway from the game was that Jokic didn't log any minutes next to Mason Plumlee -- Jokic's advanced stats are better across the board when Plumlee is off the floor and he's clearly more comfortable playing all his minutes at the five. The Denver offense was running through him even more than usual tonight and he grabbed nine offensive rebounds, finishing 11-of-23 from the field and 7-of-10 from the line. His owners will be hoping that coach Malone sticks with this rotation on Wednesday vs. the Clippers.

            Larry Nance (right hip pointer) is being listed as questionable for Wednesday's game against the Thunder.
        
        
             Nance played through the hip issue on Monday, but it may have gotten worse overnight. We'll have a better idea on his status following Wednesday morning's shootaround, but if he does need to hit the sidelines, Kyle Kuzma and Julius Randle would pick up most of his minutes. Stay tuned.
        
        
             Related: Kyle Kuzma, Julius Randle
              
             Source: Serena Winters on Twitter                         Jan 16 - 3:25 PM

            Andre Roberson (knee) got up some shots during Tuesday's light practice.
        
        
             The Thunder just did some light shooting and watched film on Tuesday, so this isn't much of an update. We'll have a better idea on Roberson's status for tomorrow's game based on his activity level at Wednesday morning's shootaround, but if he's out again, Terrance Ferguson will get another start.

"D'Angelo Russell
                 
                 
                      - G -  Nets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            D'Angelo Russell (knee) will not play Wednesday vs. the Spurs.
        
        
             Russell did not practice on Tuesday, but he'll be active at Wednesday morning's shootaround. He recently went through a 5-on-5 scrimmage with Brooklyn's G-League affiliate, so he has to be close. His next opportunity to get out there will be Friday against Miami. Allen Crabbe could head back to the second unit once Russell gets back to the court, and Caris LeVert's value could take a hit.
        
        
             Related: Allen Crabbe, Caris LeVert
              
             Source: Zach Braziller on Twitter                         Jan 16 - 2:44 PM

"Frank Kaminsky
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Frank Kaminsky (ankle) is being listed as questionable for Wednesday's game against the Wizards.
        
        
             Kaminsky sprained his right ankle during the fourth quarter of Monday's win over the Pistons, and he was in a good amount of pain after the injury, so it wouldn't be shocking to see him sit out Wednesday's game. We should have another update following Wednesday morning's shootaround, but if he's out, Marvin Williams and Dwight Howard would likely split most of his minutes. Johnny O'Bryant could also get into the rotation, but he wouldn't be a fantasy target.
        
        
             Related: Johnny O'Bryant, Dwight Howard, Marvin Williams
              
             Source: Zach Rosen on Twitter                             Jan 16 - 2:20 PM

"Brandon Ingram
                 
                 
                      - F -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Brandon Ingram (left ankle sprain) was able to practice with the team on Tuesday and said he was ""confident"" he would be able to play Wednesday vs. OKC.
        
        
             Ingram, who was held out of Monday's loss to Memphis, did admit he was ""a little sore,"" but was able to sprint and cut on his ankle in Tuesday's practice. The Lakers will determine Ingram's status for Wednesday's game based upon how the ankle responds to Tuesday's activity, but it's worth noting that head coach Luke Walton also said he expects Ingram to play. If he is able to get back out there, Josh Hart would get bumped back to the bench.
        
        
             Related: Jason Hart
              
             Source: Mark Trudell on Twitter                           Jan 16 - 1:45 PM

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Lonzo Ball
                 
                 
                      - G -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Lonzo Ball (sprained left knee) was unable to practice on Tuesday.
        
        
             The MRI on Ball's knee came back clean and ruled out any structural damage; however, he was unable to play Monday vs. Memphis. Luke Walton said he doesn't expect Ball to play on Wednesday against OKC, and owners can expect official confirmation following Wednesday morning's shootaorund. If he's out, Tyler Ennis, Josh Hart and Jordan Clarkson will continue to see extended minutes.
        
        
             Related: Tyler Ennis, Jordan Clarkson
              
             Source: Mark Trudell on Twitter                           Jan 16 - 1:39 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Luke Kennard
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Luke Kennard (left thumb) did not practice on Tuesday and is questionable for Wednesday's game vs. Toronto.
        
        
             This is the first time Kennard has popped up on the injury report due to a thumb issue. In fact, he has yet to miss a game due to injury this season and has played over 22 minutes in each of the Pistons last two contests. Avery Bradley (groin) and Stanley Johnson (hip) are also listed as questionable, which could leave the Pistons with little depth on Wednesday. We should have an update on the status of all three players after Wednesday morning's shootaround.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Jake Chapman on Twitter                           Jan 16 - 1:30 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Avery Bradley
                 
                 
                      - G -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Avery Bradley (groin) did not practice on Tuesday and is listed as questionable for Wednesday's game vs. the Raptors.
        
        
             This is concerning news, as Bradley was sidelined for seven straight games from mid-December through early January due to a right groin strain. Hopefully, this is more of a maintenance day off for Bradley, as opposed to a re-aggravation. We'll have to wait for a clear update from coach Stan Van Gundy before jumping to conclusions. Luke Kennard (thumb) and Stanley Johnson (hip) are also questionable for Wednesday, which means Detroit may be shorthanded at SG and on the wing.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Jake Chapman on Twitter                           Jan 16 - 1:28 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Fred VanVleet
                 
                 
                      - G -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Fred VanVleet does not have any structural damage in his injured knee and is considered day-to-day.
        
        
             VanVleet injured his right knee on a layup attempt in Monday's game vs. the Sixers. He limped off the floor and was unable to return to the contest. Fortunately, VanVleet said he was feeling better on Tuesday. We'll still consider him questionable for Wednesday's game vs. Detroit. If VanVleet is unable to play, Delon Wright would soak up additional minutes off the Raptors bench.
        
        
             Related: Delon Wright
              
             Source: Blake Murphy on Twitter                           Jan 16 - 1:20 PM

"Josh Jackson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Josh Jackson (groin) will be available to play Tuesday vs. Portland.
        
        
             T.J. Warren (back) is out, so Jackson should be looking at another start tonight, and he's someone to think about in daily leagues. In his past four appearances, Jackson has produced averages of 16.3 points, 2.0 triples, 7.0 boards, 3.3 dimes and 1.7 turnovers per contest on 41.9% shooting.

            T.J. Warren (back) will not suit up for Tuesday's game vs. Portland.
        
        
             Josh Jackson (groin) is likely looking at another start tonight, so he could be someone to consider in DFS with a favorable matchup against the Trail Blazers. This will be Warren's second straight game on the sidelines, and for now, we'll be considering him questionable for Friday's game in Denver.

"Marquese Chriss
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marquese Chriss (hip) and T.J. Warren (back) will not play Tuesday vs. the Trail Blazers.
        
        
             This will be Chriss' third straight game on the sidelines, and at this point, it's not clear exactly when he'll be back on the court. That said, Chriss was playing so well prior to going down, we'd advise trying to hang on in most leagues. With Chriss and Warren unavailable on Tuesday, Josh Jackson figures to earn another start with Devin Booker doing the heavy lifting on offense. Dragan Bender will also get another start, and he's someone to think about as a streamer.
        
        
             Related: T.J. Warren, Devin Booker, Dragan Bender, Josh Jackson
              
             Source: Phoenix Suns on Twitter                           Jan 16 - 3:34 PM
